postings.description:
Mott MacDonald Canada is currently involved in several major infrastructure projects in the rail and transit realms. We are currently seeking a CAD Technician to support our growing rail & transit team in Toronto, to assist with infrastructure assignments for public and private-sector clients.

You will have the opportunity to work for local clients such as Metrolinx and TTC. The Toronto office also supports capital projects in other geographic locations including the United States, Europe, Australia, and New Zealand. This position offers opportunities to work on projects from around the world with colleagues from various backgrounds, tapping into the expertise of our global practices.

Mott MacDonald values equality, diversity, and inclusion. You will be working with a close-knit team of motivated and diverse professionals from various backgrounds. You will receive mentorship and support from your management team and there will be opportunities for both formal and informal training. This is a chance to be a part of a progressive and rapidly growing organization.

Responsibilities:
Preparing general arrangement and detailed drawings for roadways, railways, grading, drainage, site utilities, bridges and civil structures
Preparing and revising Civil 3D BIM models and extracting 2D drawings as required
Basic design calculations
Following checking and self-checking process, issuing drawings to internal and external clients, and managing electronic information.
Responsible for good quality issue of IFC drawings and specifications
Engage as part of large multidisciplinary teams and coordinate design documents for consistency
Engage effectively and professionally in verbal and written communications
Utilize collaboration techniques for information management and implement Building Information Modelling (BIM)
Training team members in technical software and collaboration tools, design coordination workflows

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Mott MacDonald Canada Limited will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.
Candidate Specification
The ideal candidate will have the following experience:
Graduate from an accredited college program in Civil Engineering Technology, CAD Technology, or from a career college in Engineering CAD / BIM Technology
5+ years progressive design experience as a modeling practitioner
OACETT registration as a Certified Engineering Technician or Technologist or the ability to obtain
Excellent time management skills, setting priorities, to complete deliverables on time
Proficiency in using AutoDesk (AutoCAD/Civil 3D) and/or Bentley (InRoads/Bentley Rail Track/ OpenRail) Software Design Packages
Self-starter with strong analytical and problem-solving skills to understand what tasks are required to deliver projects and assignments successfully, as well as solving technical challenges while developing new workflows.
Prepare final drawings based on prior work examples and other input from designers or engineers
Genuine interest to develop and progress digital delivery with a propensity for learning.
Maintain and improve on knowledge of drafting techniques, standards, practices, and engineering procedures.
The following additional attributes are preferred:
Strong written and communication skills
Confident and positive attitude
Ability to build and harbor good working relationships with our business partners, suppliers, contractors, and clients
Ability to conduct their work independently
Flexibility to travel
Job Profile
Opening opportunities with connected thinking.

Together with our clients, Mott MacDonald is solving some of the world's most intricate challenges. We search out the connections others fail to make; we unlock creativity and deliver better outcomes for the lives we touch every day.

Mott MacDonald is a wholly independent, employee-owned, multidisciplinary engineering and development consultancy servicing public and private sectors around the world with over 16,000 staff working out of 180 principal offices and delivering projects in 150 countries. Every day we build upon our reputation for technical excellence by taking on some of the world’s most prominent and challenging projects, particularly in areas such as highways and bridges, rail and transit systems, tunnels, and pipeline services.

We are positioned for healthy growth, profitability, and career opportunities across North America and around the world. As part of our growing business, we want to hear from you: the enthusiastic, collaborative, and talented individuals who enjoy problem solving and pitching in to grow a successful business. Join our team of seasoned professionals who are finding opportunities through connected thinking to develop our Mott MacDonald global presence.
Other Information
Equality, diversity and inclusion
We put equality, diversity and inclusion at the heart of our business, seeking to promote fair employment procedures and practices to ensure equal opportunities for all. We encourage individual expression in our workplace and are committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone feels they have the opportunity to contribute.

We are an equal opportunity employer and are committed to providing employment accommodation in accordance with the Ontario Human Rights Code and the Accessibility for Ontarians with Disabilities Act, 2005 (AODA). Mott MacDonald Canada Limited will provide accommodations to job applicants with disabilities throughout the recruitment process. If you require an accommodation, please notify us and we will work with you to meet your needs.

Agile working
At Mott MacDonald, we believe it makes business sense for you and your manager to choose how you can work most effectively to meet your client, team and personal commitments. We embrace agility, flexibility and trust.

More about Mott MacDonald
We’re a global engineering, management and development consultancy.
Our purpose is to improve society by considering social outcomes in everything we do, relentlessly focusing on excellence and digital innovation, transforming our clients’ businesses, our communities and employee opportunities.
A fundamental part of this is respecting each person’s differences and striving to meet their needs.
Our values: progress, respect, integrity, drive, excellence

Job Description

Key Responsibilities

Lead and support functional safety assessments and analysis of novel components, systems and customer centric features developed in advanced technology projects.
Determine System Safety scope, deliverables, and timelines, and develop a System Safety Project Plan for advanced technology projects.
Work with project leads to identify the necessary System Safety resources and lead execution of safety tasks identified in the System Safety Project plan.
Support project leads in the development of Statements of Development Work (SODWs) by providing System Safety related targets, requirements and expectations.
Support the supplier selection process by assessing capability and performance of suppliers related to the GM Safety process.
Lead technical reviews (Formal and Informal) for all System Safety deliverables.
Lead System Safety strategy design discussions and work with project teams and suppliers to ensure safety requirements are comprehensive and incorporated in the design.
Provide guidance to advanced technology project teams and suppliers on GM safety process.
Work with project teams and suppliers to resolve conflicts concerning safety requirements and involve the assigned Senior System Safety Engineer as required.
Escalate unresolved safety related issues and concerns to management in accordance with the GM Issue Resolution process.
Document System Safety best practices implemented by project teams for potential reuse in other advanced technology projects and/or programs.
Interface with Senior System Safety Engineer, corporate and industry experts to stay current in safety processes, methods and tools.
Required Skills and Experience

In-depth experience and demonstrated technical knowledge in one OR more of the following:
Transportation System Safety
Electrical Design and Architecture, Software, Vehicle Dynamics, Active Safety, EMC or Control Theory
Electrical Systems, Architecture and Component Design and Development, Software Design and Development
Systems Engineering
Control systems development and rapid prototyping using MATLAB/Simulink and/or CarSim software tools
Experience or knowledge of tools such as Rhapsody, IBM Rational DOORS, IBM Rational Team Concert. Hands-on experience and demonstrated proficiency in qualitative and quantitative fault analysis using failure mode and effects (FMEA) analysis, fault tree analysis (FTA) and other industry common fault analysis tools and techniques.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.
Experience or knowledge of relevant software tools such as Fault Tree Plus and Medini Analyze
High level of interpersonal skills with a demonstrated ability to work effectively cross-functionally and cross-culturally.
Demonstrated self-starter who can work independently and manage ambiguity.
Expert knowledge and experience with IEC 61508 and/or ISO 26262.
Experience with sensor and/or fusion related projects.
People with a passion for trailering, electrical systems, new technologies or mobility systems
Expertise in developing various levels of technical specifications for mechatronic systems
Several years of demonstrated technical knowledge and ability in relevant engineering disciplines such as Electrical Design and Architecture, Software, Vehicle Dynamics, Active Safety, EMC, or Control Theory
History of success in applying advanced technology to enhance usability of complex systems
Strong organizational, problem solving and analytical skills.
Experience with Python and MATLAB programming
Experience with image processing and computer vision algorithms (OpenCV library).
Experience with microcontrollers (MABX, Arduino, Raspberry Pi, SoCs...) and sensors.
Highly adaptable and able to work independently and in a team environment
Valid Canadian Driver's License
Able to travel to the United States
Preferred Skills and Experience

DFSS Black Belt or Red X Master
Vehicle Dynamics, Chassis, Active Safety and/or Infotainment systems knowledge and experience.
Vehicle Health Monitoring knowledge.
Design release engineering experience.
Education and Training

Minimum Bachelor's degree in Engineering, or related degree; Electrical, Mechatronics, Machine Learning, Computer Vision, Artificial Intelligence, Computer, Systems Design
Advanced Degrees preferred
2+ years experience designing and engineering state-of-the-art products in the mobility or consumer electronics sector - Strong understanding of major mobility subsystem

Additional Job Description

Successful candidates will be required to attest to, and be prepared to provide proof of, their vaccination status and that any job offer will be conditional on the candidate being fully vaccinated.

About GM

Our vision is a world with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion and we embrace the responsibility to lead the change that will make our world better, safer and more equitable for all.

Why Join Us

We aspire to be the most inclusive company in the world. We believe we all must make a choice every day - individually and collectively - to drive meaningful change through our words, our deeds and our culture. Our Work Appropriately philosophy supports our foundation of inclusion and provides employees the flexibility to work where they can have the greatest impact on achieving our goals, dependent on role needs. Every day, we want every employee, no matter their background, ethnicity, preferences, or location, to feel they belong to one General Motors team.

Diversity Information

General Motors is committed to being a workplace that is not only free of discrimination, but one that genuinely fosters inclusion and belonging. We strongly believe that workforce diversity creates an environment in which our employees can thrive and develop better products for our customers. We understand and embrace the variety through which people gain experiences whether through professional, personal, educational, or volunteeropportunities.

We encourage interested candidates to review the key responsibilities and qualifications and apply for any positions that match your skills and capabilities.

Equal Employment Opportunity Statement

Accommodation is available for applicants with disabilities. Should you be contacted by General Motors of Canada, please advise if you require accommodation. General Motors of Canada values diversity and is an equal opportunity employer.

If you are looking for a challenging and exciting career in the world of technology, then look no further. Skyworks is an innovator of high performance analog semiconductors whose solutions are powering the wireless networking revolution. At Skyworks, you will find a fast-paced environment with a strong focus on global collaboration, minimal layers of management and the freedom to make meaningful contributions in a setting that encourages creativity and out-of-the-box thinking. Our work culture values diversity, social responsibility, open communication, mutual trust and respect. We are excited about the opportunity to work with you and glad you want to be part of a team of talented individuals who together can change the way the world communicates.
Requisition ID: 66926

Job Description

PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY: Designs, develops, modifies and evaluates electronic parts, components or integrated circuitry for electronic equipment and other hardware systems. Determines design approaches and parameters. Analyzes equipment to establish operating data, conducts experimental tests and evaluates results. Selects components and equipment based on analysis of specifications and reliability. May also review vendor capability to support product development.
The successful candidate will possess a full understanding of electromagnetics and RF circuits, and be a driven, committed team player.
Our design team is responsible for designing and simulating all passive aspects of front-end modules including output matching networks, integrated passive devices, thermal simulation, filter design and coupling analysis all under the ever-present constraint of minimizing package size.
It is critical the applicant has valuable experience in taking multiple programs from conception to production efficiently and effectively.
Please note this is not a die design position. Our team has direct interaction with the die design teams to ensure product success.
Responsibilities include but are not limited to:
Adapting best laminate design and full module co-simulation practicesDesigning RF matching networks in a compact environmentDesigning high-isolation laminate layouts to meet high density component module and able to meet
stringent requirements such as de-sense, harmonics, radiation, etc.
Participating and conducting design reviewsPerforming lab testing and tuning and using various RF test equipment
The circuit blocks involved in a typical product development may include:
Power AmplifiersIntegrated Passive DevicesSAW/BAW Duplexers & High-Q RF FiltersSwitchesLow Noise AmplifiersMatching circuitsHigh-directivity couplersThird party baseband die
Software Tools Used are:
Ansoft HFSSAgilent ADS and MomentumCadence Allegro and Virtuoso LayoutExcelMicrosoft Office/Outlook
Hardware Tools Used are:
Network AnalyzersSpectrum AnalyzersSignal GeneratorsDigital ReceiversLoad-Pull/TunersRF Probe StationsThermal Stations
Qualification and Education Requirements:
BSEE, MS or PhD5 Year experience with a track record of successful program completionLeadership skillsWord, Excel, Power point, OutlookExperiences of EM tools such as HFSS, or MomentumLab experiences of network analyzer, signal generator, spectrum analyzer and probe stationKnowledge of HBT, FET, CMOS devicesKnowledge of RF switch design, or power amplifier design, or PA classes, PAE, PA performanceKnowledge of sensitivity, intermodulation, de-sense, ACLR, EVM

Preferred Skills:
Experience in ADS, Virtuoso, and Allegro

Skyworks is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Segment: Electrical Engineering, Engineer, Electrical, Thermal Engineering, Network, Engineering, Technology

Job Description

The Job posting will close on 7th December 2021 @ 11:59 PM

This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within Ontario, Canada.

Software Defined Vehicle (SDV) group is responsible for the definition, design, and development of General Motors' continuously improving mobility services. SDV is the new vehicle intelligence platform that will underpin all our future innovations across a wide range of technological advancements, including EVs and expanded automated driving. This means that you can potentially put a fingerprint on the vehicles that drive down the road! This space is ripe with technical leadership opportunities for advanced technology development, as well as the ability to provide mentorship for new employees. You can flex your teamwork muscles as you will be tasked with working with several other areas of engineering, IT, and the business.

The Systems Capability Speci will lead the architecture and requirements development for systems related to the next-generation of Connected Vehicle, Automated Driving (L2+) and Autonomous (L4) technologies being developed at GM. They will develop deep knowledge related to their system and be considered the technical expert for system design and performance. The utilization of 'systems level thinking' will be key in this role. We are looking for a highly energetic and creative thinker who is addicted to an attention to detail. We are looking for someone who can work with a high-performance team to manage the technology and process to ensure timely delivery of their modules. If you love the idea of shared accountability and have a passion for changing the world we are looking for you! Come and join the team that is shaping the landscape in the automotive industry.

Key Responsibilities:

Lead all aspects of systems development such as requirements definition, analysis and development of their applicable system

System Technical Specification development along with FMEA

Implement new feature and functions, perform hands-on testing and issue triage, support development of necessary tools and perform performance analysis as needed.

Support Tier 1 & 2 development of these technologies into GM products

Build mechanization drawing with assistance from architecture team

Create and maintain applicable system/subsystem/component software specifications in IBM DOORS / DOORS Next Generation (DNG)

Lead/participate in software peer reviews to ensure compliance to requirements

Provide technical leadership for sophisticated technology development

Collaborate with other System Engineers and specialists to define and negotiate key functional and performance requirements

Root cause all applicable system related issues during testing and validation

Ensure work is completed as per the milestones with excellence

Responsible for compliance with GM processes and safety procedures

Represent the team globally as a key partner to the product

Support and/or lead activities for customer outreach and education in these technologies and their respective use cases

Cumulative travel requirements of 2 to 6 weeks a year are typical, primarily to Michigan and other locations in the US

Additional Job Description

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related technical degree

Minimum of 5 years of experience with automotive or similar electronic modules and/or systems engineering

Proficiency in writing and comprehending software and hardware requirements and interfaces

Experience with requirement management tools such as DOORS, DNG, JAMA etc.

Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and specifications

High level of oral and written communication skills and basic project management skills

Ability to work in a fast-paced environment with colleagues local and at remote sites

Comfortable with ambiguity and has a passion to shape the future

Strong technical leadership skills and able to work in a highly collaborative environment

Creative, disciplined, strong sense of responsibility, delivery and schedule commitment

Preferred Qualifications:

Advanced degree

Understanding of major automotive vehicle systems such as Advanced Driver-Assistance (ADAS), Motion Control, Automotive Network, and Powertrain

Experience in performing system and component level DFMEAs

DFSS Black belt certification

Design/Development of safety critical systems/components (ISO26262)

Experience in automotive product release and specification process

About Voltera

Voltera empowers educators, researchers, and engineers asking questions about, and building, the technologies of tomorrow — by giving them the tools they need to design, test, develop, and ship products faster than ever before.
Our flagship product, the Voltera V-One, is a desktop circuit board factory that allows educators to introduce the world of printable electronics to young minds, researchers to answer new and old questions, and electronics engineers to cut their prototype time from months to minutes. We’re consistently among the top growing companies in Canada and our machines are used by 2000+ electronics educators, researchers and developers in over 60 countries around the world, We will soon be releasing a product that will, for the first time, allow for the design of electronics that are flexible, stretchable, biocompatible and much, much more. We’re just getting started, and we’re excited.
As we ramp up bringing new products to market and dreaming newer ones into being, we need all hands on deck. Are you ready to be part of the Voltera revolution?
What You’ll Do

Manage the full-cycle recruitment process from screening resumes to sending out offers.
Partner with hiring managers to create job descriptions by understanding the required skills and background.
Proactively search for and attract candidates through various sourcing methods.
Ensure a high-quality candidate experience through every stage of the recruitment process.
Providing guidance and coaching to hiring teams on all aspects of the recruitment process.
Maintain job postings and data within our applicant tracking system (BambooHR).


Who You Are

2+ years of experience in full-cycle recruitment or similar role
Proven track record for providing exceptional candidate experience
Strong time management and organizational skills
Experience with BambooHR or other applicant tracking system


Nice to Haves

Experience sourcing candidates through different channels


Does this sound like an exciting role to you? If so, please apply online and let us know why you’d like to join the Voltera team.


Voltera is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to inclusion and diversity. Voltera does not discriminate based on race, ancestry, place of origin, colour, ethnic origin, citizenship, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, record of offences, marital status, family status, disability or any other basis forbidden under federal, provincial, or local law.
Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process. If you require accommodation, or require recruitment documents in a different format, please contact us at accessibility [at] voltera [dot] io.

Job Description

As an Integration Engineer for Mapping in ADAS. The successful candidate will be part of a fast-paced, agile team responsible for defining, developing, and deploying the mapping software platform for the vehicles of the future within the Active Safety and Autonomous Group. You will work cross-functionally with multiple teams to quickly deliver in-house solutions and products that support GM's vision of a future with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion. Join our agile team and let's create the future together!

Responsibilities

Responsible for end to end Software Quality for Mapping team deliverables, including:
Feature design and architecture analysis, ensuring test driven design principles and testability of SW.
Acceptance criteria and tests for SW deliverables.
Test suite creation and maintenance, including recommended strategy for black box, white box, integration, SIL/ HIL, in vehicle and KPI/ performance tests.
Automation script design and development.
Code coverage and requirements coverage analysis.
Develop robust test infrastructure and tools with a focus on quality, scalability, real-time processing, and high platform availability.
Interface with engineering teams and other internal/ external stakeholders.
Integrate with our CI/CD processes for new and existing services.
Assist in first level log/ data collection, debug, triage, and root cause of critical issues.
Assist with test platform, tool and integration issues.

Requirements

BS or higher in Electrical/ Mechanical/ Computer Engineering or Computer Science
3+ years' experience in integration testing or software development.
2+ years of experience with flash programing and utility files, and instrumentation (INCA, in circuit emulators).
Ability to write and automate test scripts in Python or other languages.
Prior software experience, preferably in C/C++ with exposure to bash and windows batch scripting.
Knowledge of serial data communications (Ethernet (preferred), CAN, LIN, AUTOSAR).
Knowledge and experience in system integration and testing of hardware and software.
Experience analyzing and verifying software requirements.
High level of analytical ability to resolve complex problems independently and investigate issues based on limited information.
Disciplined, strong sense of responsibility, delivery, and schedule commitment.
Must be available to work in the lab in CTC Markham, Ontario and occasionally in CTC Oshawa, Ontario, in compliance with COVID-19 measures.
Must be legally allowed to work in Canada and be able to occasionally travel to the US.

Additional Job Description

Preferred Skills and Experience

Experience working with embedded microprocessors, cross compilers, low level memory, large code bases.
Experience with SAFe or Agile Scrum methodologies.
Understanding of major automotive vehicle systems such as Advanced Driver-Assistance (ADAS), Motion Control, Automotive Network, and Powertrain.
Exposure to the Adaptive AUTOSAR service-based vehicle platforms.
Knowledge of low-level hardware interfaces, serial programming, message authentication, diagnostics, vehicle electrical interfaces, legislated compliance, vehicle assembly and service tool interfaces, etc.
Knowledgeable about ISO 26262 V&V.
Software controls/ wiring/ electronics experience.
Exposure to sensors - cameras, radars, LiDARs

Job Description

The successful candidate will be part of a team of engineers responsible for the integration and testing of Software Defined Vehicle(SDV) on advanced controllers. You will work cross-functionally with multiple teams to deliver in-house solutions and products that support GM's vision of a future with Zero Crashes, Zero Emissions and Zero Congestion. Join our agile team and let's create the future together!

Core Responsibilities

Deliver integrated hardware, software & calibration for Development, Production and Service by ensuring program execution to standard processes
Support software teams to develop and execute Key Behavior Tests (KBTs) and Milestone Tests (Global B controllers), both manually and automated
Verify control module functionality on bench and in vehicle (examples: perception systems, lateral & longitudinal control systems, mapping & localization systems etc.)
Develop test protocols and scripts for validating hardware and software integration
Support continuous development of new test features, processes, and methodologies
Work collaboratively with multiple agile teams to help deliver end-to-end products and features, seeing them through from conception to delivery

Additional Job Description

Required Skills and Experience

Bachelor's degree in Software/Computer/Electrical/Embedded Systems/Electronics Engineering or equivalent field

3+ years' experience with either software development,softwareintegrationand/orsoftwaretesting

Prior software experience, preferably in C/C++ with exposure to bash, python and windows batch scripting

Knowledge and experience insafety criticalembeddedcontrol system integration andtesting in a HIL environment

Ability to independently investigate issues based on limited information,demonstrating high level of analytical ability to resolve complex problems

Creative, disciplined, strong sense of responsibility, delivery,and schedule commitment

Must be legally allowed to work in Canada and be able to travel to the US

Must have a valid Canadian driver's license

Preferred Skills and Experience

Understanding of major automotive vehicle systems such as Advanced Driver-Assistance (ADAS), Software Defined Vehicle(SDV),Motion Control, Automotive Network, and Powertrain

Experience withLinuxor QNXOS/file system

Experience withtest software such asCANoe, Vehicle Spy,INCA,AutoVAL

Knowledge of serial data communications (Ethernet (preferred), CAN, LIN)

Exposure to the Adaptive AUTOSAR service-based vehicle platform

Exposure to CI/CDdevelopment methodologies

Experience with Unit Test tools e.g. (CppUTest, Google Testetc) and respectiveJenkinsplugins

Experience withAgile/SAFemethodologies

Job Description

We are looking for experienced and highly motivated integration specialist for the role of Lead Software Integration within our Automated Driving Mapping Software Applications group. The selected candidate shall be an expert on release process, tools and frameworks and must have a strong sense of quality ownership. The candidate must have proven expertise in development and deployment of SW release strategies for embedded systems, preferably automotive.

Responsibilities

Final gatekeeper for all releases for Mapping SW team and map data to our downstream customers and regions globally.
Responsible for consolidating all SW changes, building all dependent changes, and ensuring adequate testing of Mapping SW to ensure on time deliveries.
Facilitatesoftwareproduct development andrelease activities. Communicate with design release engineers, system engineers, product owners and other stakeholders. Set clear scope of testingand developmenteffort required for eachincrementalsoftware release.
Working with leadership and key stakeholders to ensure SW releases are scheduled and delivered on time with quality across all programs.
Responsible for helping to define end to end Software Quality Strategy for Mapping team deliverables, including:
Feature design and architecture strategy, ensuring test driven design principles and testability of SW.
Defining acceptance criteria and tests for SW deliverables.
Strategy definition of SW release test suites for black box, white box, integration, SIL/ HIL, in vehicle and KPI/ performance tests.
Helping define robust test infrastructure and tools with a focus on quality, scalability, real-time processing, and high platform availability.
Ensuring integration with our CI/CD processes for new and existing services.
Point of contact for first level log/ data collection, debug, triage, and root cause of critical issues.
Point of contact for test platform, tool, and integration issues.
Prioritize deliverables and remove roadblocks to accelerate delivery of quality software.
Participate in the continuous improvement of test processes and methodologies, and support with hands on testing of embedded applications, as required.

Requirements

BS or higher in Electrical/ Mechanical/ Computer Engineering or Computer Science
5+ years of test automation experience in embedded or automotive industry.
3+ years of experience with C++or other object orientated programming language.
3+ years of experience with flash programing and utility files, and instrumentation (JTAG, NAND, UART, IPC).
Strong experience with SW build framework, process, and execution (cmake, gcc).
Strong experience with GIT versioning control system.
Solid shell scripting and command line tool experience
Solid knowledge of software quality assurance methodologies and tools.
Comfortable working in Linux environment.
Knowledge of serial data communications (Ethernet (preferred), CAN, LIN, AUTOSAR).
Knowledge and experience in system integration and testing of hardware and software.
Experience analyzing and verifying software requirements.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Strong leadership skills to motivate the teams, work efficiently and deliver on time in a fast-paced work environment.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, coordination skills, and interpersonal skills.
Disciplined, strong sense of responsibility, delivery, and schedule commitment.
Must be available to work in the lab in CTC Markham, Ontario and occasionally in CTC Oshawa, Ontario, in compliance with COVID-19 measures.
Must be legally allowed to work in Canada and be able to occasionally travel to the US.

Additional Job Description

Preferred Skills and Experience

Technical or leadership experience working with embedded microprocessors, cross compilers, low level memory, large code bases.
Experience with Blackberry QNX andGreenHillsGHS RTOS.
Network knowledge is a plus (TCP/IP, UDP,DoIPprotocols, Wireshark Tool).
Knowledgeable about ISO 26262 V&V,ASPICEstandard is a plus.
Experience with SAFe or Agile Scrum methodologies.
Understanding of major automotive vehicle systems such as Advanced Driver-Assistance (ADAS), Motion Control, Camera, Automotive Network, and Powertrain.
Exposure to the Adaptive AUTOSAR service-based vehicle platforms.
Software controls/ wiring/ electronics experience.

Job Description

The Job posting will close on 7th December 2021 @ 11:59 PM

This is a remote position, the selected candidate can reside and perform the work from anywhere within Ontario, Canada.

Software Defined Vehicle (SDV) group is responsible for the definition, design, and development of General Motors' continuously improving mobility services. SDV is the new vehicle intelligence platform that will underpin all our future innovations across a wide range of technological advancements, including EVs and expanded automated driving. This means that you can potentially put a fingerprint on the vehicles that drive down the road! This space is ripe with technical leadership opportunities for advanced technology development, as well as the ability to provide mentorship for new employees. You can flex your teamwork muscles as you will be tasked with working with several other areas of engineering, IT, and the business.

The Lead System Capability Specialist will be a technical leader for requirements and design development for a set of business features related to the next-generation of Connected Vehicle, Automated Driving (L2+) and Autonomous (L4) technologies being developed at GM. The candidate will be responsible for the end-to-end implementation of the said features. As the Lead System Capability Specialist, they will lead the strategy and execution of the specific capability domain as it combines with other capability domains and architecture to deliver these solutions. They will work with various cross-functional teams to drive and meet the program milestones. They will be the single point contact for the execution of the set of features from inception to launch. They will develop deep understanding of their problem space and be considered the technical expert for system design and performance. The utilization of 'systems level thinking' will be key in this role.

We are looking for a highly energetic and creative thinker who is addicted to an attention to detail. We are looking for someone who can work with a high-performance team to manage the technology and process to ensure timely delivery of their modules. If you love the idea of shared accountability and have a passion for changing the world we are looking for you! Come and join the team that is shaping the landscape in the automotive industry!

Key Responsibilities:

Ownership of feature/capability strategy by defining technology and enablers and cross-collaborating with multiple teams to ensure feasibility and viability

Single point contact for feature execution working with the various program teams, leadership and engineering teams for a successful and robust launch.

Provide regular and key updates to the leadership and team leaders to ensure synchronization and smooth flow of information

Lead other system capability engineers by providing direction in all aspects of systems development such as requirements definition, analysis and development of their applicable features/systems/capabilities

Continuously work towards improving efficiency within the group by improving processes, quality and mentoring the team members.

Lead/participate in software peer reviews to ensure compliance to requirements

Provide technical leadership for sophisticated technology development

Collaborate with other System Engineers and specialists to define and negotiate key functional and performance requirements

Root cause all applicable system related issues during testing and validation

Participate in Pre-Production builds (IV Builds & CTF) at PPO and provide feedback

Ensure work is completed as per the milestones with excellence

Responsible for compliance with GM processes and safety procedures

Represent the team globally as a key partner to the product

Support and/or lead activities for customer outreach and education in these technologies and their respective use cases

Talent development within the team and the Systems Engineering group

Cumulative travel requirements of 2 to 6 weeks a year are typical, primarily to Michigan and other locations in the US

Additional Job Description:

Basic Qualifications:

Bachelor of Science degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Electrical Engineering or related technical degree

Minimum of 8 years of experience with automotive or similar electronic modules and systems engineering

Experience in performing system and component level DFMEAs

DFSS Black belt certification

Deep knowledge of systems engineering principles

Strong technical leadership skills and an ability to work in a highly collaborative environment with colleagues local and at remote sites

Demonstrated proficiency in writing and comprehending software and hardware requirements and interfaces

Experience with requirement management tools such as DOORS, DNG, JAMA etc.

Design/Development of safety critical systems/components (ISO26262)

Experience in automotive product release and specification process

Ability to read and interpret engineering drawings and specifications

Understanding of major automotive vehicle systems such as Advanced Driver-Assistance (ADAS), Motion Control, Automotive Network, and Powertrain

High level of oral and written communication skill with strong project management skills

Preferred Qualifications:

Master's degree in a related technical field

Job Description

We are looking for experienced and highly motivated technical specialist for the role of Technical Lead - Test Automation within our Automated Driving Mapping Software Applications group. The selected candidate shall be an expert on automation tools and frameworks and must have a strong sense of quality ownership. The candidate must have proven expertise in development and deployment of test automation strategies for embedded systems, preferably automotive.

Responsibilities

Responsible for leading and defining end to end Software Quality Strategy for Mapping team deliverables to ensure on time quality SW delivery, including:
Feature design and architecture strategy, ensuring test driven design principles and testability of SW.
Defining acceptance criteria and tests for SW deliverables.
Strategy definition and execution of test suites - sanity, nightly, regression for black box, white box, integration, SIL/ HIL, in vehicle and KPI/ performance tests.
Automation strategy, design, and development.
Code coverage and requirements coverage analysis and roadmap.
Provide technical leadership to Integration/ QA team members, enabling them to achieve targeted quality strategy and goals.
Be an expert in test script development and automation.
Defining robust test infrastructure and tools with a focus on quality, scalability, real-time processing, and high platform availability.
Point of contact for engineering teams and other internal/ external stakeholders.
Ensuring integration with our CI/CD processes for new and existing services.
Point of contact in first level log/ data collection, debug, triage, and root cause of critical issues.
Point of contact for test platform, tool, and integration issues.
Prioritize deliverables and remove roadblocks to accelerate delivery of quality software.
Participate in the continuous improvement of test processes and methodologies, and support with hands on testing of embedded applications, as required.

Requirements

BS or higher in Electrical/ Mechanical/ Computer Engineering or Computer Science
7+ years of test automation experience in embedded or automotive industry.
3+ years of experience with flash programing and utility files, and instrumentation (INCA, in circuit emulators).
Strong experience with test automation framework, tool development and scripting.
Solid knowledge of software quality assurance methodologies and tools.
Programming skills in common languages, such as Python, JAVA, C++, or others.
Knowledge of serial data communications (Ethernet (preferred), CAN, LIN, AUTOSAR).
Knowledge and experience in system integration and testing of hardware and software.
Experience analyzing and verifying software requirements.
Outstanding verbal and written communication skills.
Strong leadership skills to motivate the teams, work efficiently and deliver on time in a fast-paced work environment.
Strong problem-solving and analytical skills, coordination skills, and interpersonal skills.
Disciplined, strong sense of responsibility, delivery, and schedule commitment.
Must be available to work in the lab in CTC Markham, Ontario and occasionally in CTC Oshawa, Ontario, in compliance with COVID-19 measures.
Must be legally allowed to work in Canada and be able to occasionally travel to the US.

Additional Job Description

Preferred Skills and Experience

Technical or leadership experience working with embedded microprocessors, cross compilers, low level memory, large code bases.
Experience with SAFe or Agile Scrum methodologies.
Understanding of major automotive vehicle systems such as Advanced Driver-Assistance (ADAS), Motion Control, Automotive Network, and Powertrain.
Exposure to the Adaptive AUTOSAR service-based vehicle platforms.
Knowledge of low-level hardware interfaces, serial programming, message authentication, diagnostics, vehicle electrical interfaces, legislated compliance, vehicle assembly and service tool interfaces, etc.
Knowledgeable about ISO 26262 V&V.
Software controls/ wiring/ electronics experience.
Exposure to sensors - cameras, radars, LiDARs.
Exhibits appropriate interpersonal styles and communication methods to work effectively with business partners to meet mutual goals.
High level analytical ability where problems are unusual and complex.

About Us
Building and maintaining our provincial infrastructure is no small job.

The Highway Planning and Design Team at the Department of Public Works is responsible for the planning and design of complex provincial highway projects, from functional design to detailed design. We’re committed to delivering optimum solutions and enhancing the quality of our province’s road network.

If you’re seeking an opportunity to directly impact highway programs, engineering and construction, while watching your creativity and innovative ideas come to life, then this is your next great adventure.


About Our Opportunity
As the Highway Planning Engineer, you are a key member of the Highway Planning and Design team and directly impact the growth of Nova Scotia’s road network.


Primary Accountabilities
You are responsible for assisting in all aspects of short to long-range highway planning initiatives for major highway expansion projects, including: new sections of highway, twinning of existing highways, interchanges and intersections. This includes the identification and analysis of upgrading options; route location and corridor (land) preservation for new highways; and the review of reports, Transportation studies and Environmental Assessment or Screening reports.

You will use highway design software (AutoCAD Civil 3D) to develop preliminary concepts and functional designs in accordance with transportation planning best practices, appropriate guidelines and standards, such as the TAC Geometric Design Guide for Canadian Roads and the Nova Scotia Highway Design Guidelines and Standard Plans. You may also be called upon to organize and represent the department at stakeholder meetings (including public consultations), serve on various committees and project teams as well as manage and oversee the work of external consulting firms. You are a key resource in providing highway planning/design advice and assistance to departmental staff and other government agencies.


Qualifications and Experience
A Bachelor’s degree in Civil Engineering from an accredited engineering institution is required. You must be (or meet the requirements to be) actively registered as an Engineer-In-Training (EIT) or Full Member (P.Eng) with Engineers Nova Scotia (ENS).

Occasional travel throughout the province is required. As such, you must have a valid driver’s license and ability to travel.

As the ideal candidate, you will be a highly-motivated team player and possess sound judgement, effective communication skills and strong attention to detail. You must be a self-starter, motivated and be able to perform with minimal supervision. You must have the ability to conduct research, gather technical information and clearly present it in layman's terms both verbally and in writing.

A good understanding of the highway planning process and in using highway design guidelines and standards such as the TAC Geometric Design Guide is required. Experience in the use of software for word processing, spreadsheets and civil design (such as AutoCAD) is required, while experience with AutoCAD Civil 3D is considered a definite asset.

Demonstrated experience in leading and coordinating project teams, stakeholder engagement, as well as experience in public speaking and/or giving formal presentations is a definite asset. A working knowledge in the Department of Public Work's Highway Design Guidelines, Standard Specification for Highway Construction and Maintenance, Public Highways Act, Environment Act and Environmental Assessment processes are other assets to be considered.


Benefits
Based on the employment status and union agreement, the Government of Nova Scotia offers its employees a wide range of benefits such as Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Pension, General Illness (Short and Long Term), Vacation and Employee and Family Assistance Programs. Click here to learn more about our various benefits offerings and eligibility criteria.


Working Conditions
This role is primarily based in a comfortable office environment, and you may be working at your computer for extended periods of time. You may be required to travel within the province to visit sites or regional offices.


Additional Information
On October 6, 2021 the Government of Nova Scotia announced full vaccination will be a condition of employment for new staff being hired. View the news release here.

An Engineer must be “Licensed to Practice” as determined by Engineers of Nova Scotia (ENS) before being classified as an Engineer 3.

This is a term opportunity with an approximate end date of December 30, 2022.


What We Offer
Career Development where you have access to career guidance, tools, resources, and ongoing training for every stage of your career.
Engaging workplace. Our Employees feel valued, respected, connected, and tuned in. We have forward- thinking policies and strategies.
Countless Career Paths.

Company Summary
At NeuronicWorks, we provide hardware, software and system design services to customers planning to have a reliable product and looking for a cost-effective design. We offer complete project design and prototyping services, from concept to detail design, to building state of the art electronic systems that meet the increasing demands of today’s technology. Our mission is to deliver quality design with visionary, innovative and practical solutions to our customers.
Position Responsibilities
We are looking for experienced Project Managers to manage and successfully deliver key client projects. The successful candidate will be responsible for:
Delivery of projects on-time, within scope, within budget and to the required level of quality.
Drive positive business relationship with clients by keeping the client informed and involved in the development process and by adding value to the client’s business.
Lead cross functional teams through the development process, in the following disciplines: HW &FW engineering, Mechanical and Industrial design, Desktop, Web and Mobile Applications.
Coordination of internal resources and third parties/vendors for a flawless execution of projects
Successfully apply Waterfall and Agile development methodologies.
Develop and manage the project schedule and resource allocation, monitor the project cost, manage changes according to company procedures.
Clearly communicate to management the state of the project: client relationship, risk, issues, milestones and proposed solutions.
Establish and maintain relationships with third parties/vendors.
Preparation and review of the following documents: requirements document, SOW, design presentations and test plans and reports.
Support Business development in preparation of quotes and proposals and in active retention of existing clients.
Interface with procurement and ensure the timely supply of components and materials to the engineers.
Requirements
5+ years of experience in project management with a proven track record of delivering projects to client’s satisfaction.
Experience in one of the following industries: Medical Devices, Consumer Electronics, Automotive, Mobile App market.
Proven ability to lead cross functional teams through the development process, in the following disciplines: HW &FW engineering, Mechanical and Industrial design, Desktop, Web and Mobile Applications.
Solid technical background and hands-on experience in one of the disciplines above.
Strong experience in management client facing projects.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.
Strong organizational skills including the ability to define and prioritize work for the development team, attention to detail.
Strong time management skills including prioritization, management of multiple projects concurrently, and ability to respond quickly and efficiently to changes.
Knowledge of Microsoft Office, Jira and project management tools.
PMP or Scrum certification is an advantage.
Permanent resident or Canadian citizen.
Key Attributes
Commitment to complete work on time and at a high level of quality.
Courage to think critically, to ask for help, to innovate and improve.
Focused on finding solutions and deliver value to clients.
Openness to talk about challenges and receive guidance and advice.
Readiness to help and support the team with any task.
Ability to handle multiple diverse assignments successfully in a consulting firm environment.
Good level of organization and time management skills and ability to co-ordinate multiple tasks.
Uncompromised commitment to confidentiality.
Education
B.Sc. in Electrical Engineering, Computer Science or Equivalent.
To apply, send your resume to careers@neuronicworks.com

Job Description: Line Pilot
To perform Pilot-in-Command flight and related duties on VFR equipped single and twin-engine helicopters as required by Hydro One Networks Inc.

1. Duties / Responsibilities:
Act as Pilot in Command on any of Hydro One Networks Inc. helicopters as directed by the Operations Manager or delegate by:
Being responsible for the operation and safety of the helicopter, and for the safety and security of all persons involved during flight operations.
Having final authority to conduct or cancel scheduled flight operations.
Ensuring that the helicopter is operated in accordance with Aircraft Flight Manual and all applicable orders, standard operation procedures, Transport Canada regulations, Hydro One policies, and directives.
Providing liaison with internal Hydro One lines of business in determining the flight operation of the helicopter to deliver the necessary expertise for helicopter related work. This will be coordinated with the Operations Coordinator and the Chief Pilot.
taking required training courses as directed by the Chief Pilot, and Transport Canada policies (i.e. recurrent training on helicopter types and configurations AS350 B2/B3, H-125, AS355NP, and other types as required
Demonstrate good judgment and decision making ability.
Providing safety briefings including instruction on aircraft safety/survival equipment location and techniques of use in the event of emergency.
Thorough pre-job planning as well as conducting and participating in tailboard meetings.
Providing instruction and mentorship to Hydro One lines of business staff on helicopter approved work methods and occasionally acting as an instructor to deliver helicopter services training courses.
Conducting pre-flight inspection of the aircraft confirming serviceability and preforming pre- flight duties such as documentation, weight and balance calculations and flight planning as required
Overseeing safe configuration of aircraft, i.e. external sling loads, and adherence to all up weight load - limit specifications and proper loading and securement of cargo including use of basket.
Maintaining high standard of aircraft serviceability and cleanliness
Recording defects and assisting air engineers in defect rectification carrying out ground run-ups and flight tests of repaired and post maintenance aircraft as required.
Conducting administrative tasks at obligatory intervals such as recording flight duty times, aircraft document revision control, and expense and time sheet management,
Participating in company Safety Management system by regularly reporting hazard and incidents when encountered and aiding in the corrective action follow up process
Support Hydro One’s mission to provide reliable electricity by:
Accepting work at temporary work headquarters for extended periods of time
Adjusting regular work schedule upon short notice for emergent circumstances
Participating in a weekend pilot on call process
Wearing assigned clothing and PPE
Working comfortably with management and coworkers in a collaborative environment
Following Hydro One’s code of conduct embracing inclusiveness and refraining from workplace harassment
Conducting themselves in compliance with the Ontario Health and Safety Act and Hydro Safety Rules as directed by their immediate supervisor

2. Qualifications and Licensing
Grade 12 minimum education
Valid Class 1 Aviation Medical Certificate
Fully vaccinated against Covid-19
Valid Commercial (or higher) Canadian pilot license with minimum of 5,000 flight hours
Minimum of 2000 hours combined experience on AS355 and AS350BA, B2, B3, B3e aircraft
Restricted Radiotelephone Operator Licence
Valid Passport or ability to acquire. No restrictions for cross border travel.
Transportation of Dangerous Goods Training an asset
Recent Flying in the Wires Training an asset

3. Knowledge / Skill
Thorough knowledge of Canadian Air Regulations with significant experience flying in Canadian remote as well as high density airspace.
Extensive precision vertical reference external load experience required.
Experience conducting power line patrols, and knowledge of electrical distribution and transmission power maintenance and construction
Solid aviation knowledge base including weather reporting, GPS and electronic mapping navigational techniques, weather minima, and aircraft radio communication.
Comfortable working with modern electronic systems and document control.
Must possess and demonstrate well developed communication, public relations, and documentation writing skills.
Ability to exercise sound judgement and decisiveness in stressful and emergency situations
Must be able to work independently without constant supervision.
Experienced in Class D and/or hoist operations an asset
Survival and first aid training an asset

4. Security and Safety
Criminal record check
Driver’s abstract

5. Transportation/Travel Information
Willing to travel
Valid driver's license

6. Work Location Information
Various locations

We are growing and adding a Test and Service Engineer to our Systems Integration and Test team. This role is responsible for the hands-on commissioning and integration of mechanical, electrical, and software systems of Greenlight’s line of test equipment products. International travel, once per quarter of up to 8 weeks per year, is required to provide commissioning and training at customer sites.

The equipment is process-system related (pumps, heaters, valves, vessels, electronic and electrical components, controlled by proprietary software). The Test and Service Engineer must learn and understand the design, components, and operation of the equipment and provide objective, evidence-based analysis, design, and performance feedback. Responsibilities include:
Perform test station commissioning, configure, calibrate, and service instrumentation and data acquisition systems
Functionally test equipment against design specifications
Develop test protocols and scripts for validating equipment performance
Conduct tests, data analysis, and assess test station performance
Operate and provide design feedback of test stations in every aspect
Validate and debug Greenlight’s Emerald Software
Component and instrumentation vetting
Tune PID process and other controllers
Work hands-on repairing and troubleshooting multi-disciplinary issues
Create and update technical and procedure documents
Travel approximately 4 times a year, or more if available, to customer sites for installation, training, calibration, and servicing of test equipment
Other duties as required.

Skills and Qualifications:
Degree in Electrical or Mechanical Engineering or equivalent.
1-2 years experience in experiment design, setup, testing, data analysis, and reporting.
Strong verbal and written communication skills, as this job has a customer-facing element.
Knowledgeable in the use of hand tools and electrical diagnostic equipment.
Able to travel internationally.

Experience with one or more of the following would be considered an asset:
Applying thermodynamics and fluid mechanics theory
Mechanical, electrical, and/or software troubleshooting
Working in an environment with compressed gases
Hands-on mechanical and electrical assembly
Software programming and architecture, building PCs and PC troubleshooting
Customer service and training
Working with high voltage

While we sincerely appreciate every application, only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted

About Greenlight Innovation:

Greenlight Innovation is a key contributor to the development of a clean energy future. Please visit https://www.greenlightinnovation.com/faces-of-greenlight to meet some of our employees.Our customers use our specialized equipment to develop and build the next generation of fuel cell and battery electric vehicles and energy storage systems. We have the largest install base of electrochemical cell testing equipment in the world. Our work environment will provide opportunities for career growth and independence in a fast-paced industry, and our roots as a process-based, lean operation will provide experience in a structured, process driven environment. Our facility can be reached by Skytrain and bike lanes, and is located near the Burnaby Lake trail system.

Nous sommes à la recherche d'un ingénieur pour le service d'assistance technique, qui fournira le service technique et l’assistance dont nos clients ont besoin. Job Description
Come intern with one of the largest electrical engineering companies in the world.

Come Intern with our Programmable Solutions Group (PSG).

You will work on some aspect of the Intel Quartus compile system.

Roles and responsibilities may include to work on some of the most difficult and interesting algorithmic problems around.
Qualifications
You must possess the below minimum qualifications to be initially considered for this position. Preferred qualifications are in addition to the minimum requirements and are considered a plus factor in identifying top candidates.
Experience listed below would be obtained through a combination of your school work/classes/research and/or relevant previous job and/or internship experiences.

Join our team
The Technology Strategy Spectrum team is responsible for ensuring TELUS acquires and uses radio spectrum in the most efficient and effective possible way for the benefit of our customers and our business.

Here’s the impact you’ll make and what we’ll accomplish together
The Radio Frequency spectrum is a limited public resource and the lifeblood of the wireless industry. This is a unique opportunity to work at the intersection of wireless technology, business, and public policy, while making a significant impact on TELUS’ business, the telecommunications industry, and Canadian society at large.

Here's how
You will lead technical assessments for coexistence between different wireless services and licensees, and actively participate in and drive TELUS’ priorities through global standards bodies and other spectrum-related forums (e.g. 3GPP, RABC, ITU) as well as public consultations issued by Canada’s spectrum regulator (ISED).

Further, you will develop, maintain and support tools and processes to track TELUS spectrum assets, spectrum subordination, spectrum metrics, licence obligations, terms, and competitive spectrum intelligence.

You will also support the wireless network development and engineering teams in effectively planning, deploying and using TELUS-licensed spectrum, and ensuring TELUS is compliant with all its spectrum conditions of licence.

You're the missing piece of the puzzle
Bachelor’s degree in Electrical, Electronics or Telecommunications Engineering or related discipline
Deep understanding of wireless communications and RF engineering fundamentals, including radio propagation, capacity planning and interference management
Broad working knowledge of mobile communication technologies (LTE, 5G, Wi-Fi) and standards (3GPP, IETF) with deep understanding of their spectrum applications (band classes and ecosystems, carrier aggregation)
Knowledge of Canadian, US, European and global spectrum regulatory frameworks, and associated organizations (ISED, RABC, ITU, FCC, CEPT)
Solid understanding of spectrum management fundamentals: planning, allocation, assignment, licensing, monitoring
Programming skills (Python, Javascript)
Outstanding written and verbal communication and presentation skills
Highly organized and detail oriented
5+ years of experience in the wireless communications industry

Great-to-haves
Knowledge of radio frequency equipment design
Knowledge of project management best practices
Familiarity with auction theory and spectrum auction mechanics
Familiarity with Geographic Information Systems software and applications (QGIS, Mapinfo, GeoPandas)
Knowledge of satellite communications technology
Knowledge of fixed microwave communication technology
French language skills
MBA or Master’s/PhD degree in a Science or Engineering related discipline
2+ years of experience in Spectrum Management or Telecommunications regulation

Miovision provides cities with modern tools to fix today's traffic problems. We offer solutions that collect multimodal traffic data and uncover actionable insights, helping municipalities get more out of their road network. The result: streets capable of moving more people – safely and efficiently – whether they are in a car, on a bus, on a bike or e-scooter, or walking. Since 2005, our systems have counted more than nine billion vehicles around the world. We have offices in Kitchener, Canada as well as operations in Germany, Serbia and the US. For more information, visit miovision.com.
Position Summary
As Miovision’s Electronic Test Technician, you will focus on troubleshooting and repairing existing products and systems. You will apply your knowledge of wiring diagrams and schematics and the functions of electronic parts to debug failures found during our extensive testing processes. The successful candidate will be extremely detail-oriented and have the ability to roll up information for further analysis and reporting to all levels of management within Miovision. This position is full time and reports to the Manufacturing Manager.

Troubleshoot and repair existing products
Ability to read schematics
Ability to solder basic components - down to 0201 size
Ability to perform general measurements using tools such as a multi-meter, oscilloscope, power supply
Collect data to determine trends
Report out on weekly/monthly issues and roll-up data for further analysis
Develop and perform preventative maintenance on test and manufacturing equipment
Create, define and own the non conforming material process
Willingness to help the production line whenever necessary
Other duties as required

Minimum of a two-year diploma in electronics technology
Minimum of 5 years of related experience
Read wiring diagrams and schematics
Experience using soldering equipment
Excellent communication skills
Hand-eye coordination
Well organized
Systematic approach to root cause analysis
Familiar with standard test equipment
Advanced knowledge of electronic components
Familiarity with Windows and Linux OS and applications
Additional Assets
Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers Membership
Familiarity with Jira

Le but est de réaliser les projets dans les délais et les budgets prévus, tout en assurant la satisfaction des clients.En tant qu’ingénieur de systèmes vous de devrez : Examiner et analyser les besoins et exigences des projets ou des clients : requis du client, standards et normes législatives et locales;Examiner les ‘concepts de fonctionnement’ candidats, proposer les solutions et identifier les risques ou opportunités liés aux solutions proposées;Examiner et analyser les données techniques et les concepts opérationnels afin d’établir les exigences dérivées du système et sous-systèmes, préparer une architecture qui s'harmonise avec tous les domaines techniques pertinents des équipes d'ingénierie, des partenaires et fournisseurs;Préparer les documents et les plans conceptuels du système;Communiquer les exigences dérivées des composantes en collaboration avec les équipes spécialisées responsables de la réalisation;Voir à l’intégration, la certification et la qualification du système en étroite collaboration avec le client;Appliquer les processus d’ingénierie en place afin d’assurer la traçabilité des exigences et la qualité du système.Qualifications requises : · Détenteur d’un diplôme universitaire de premier cycle en génie électrique, informatique ou contrôle industriel avec un minimum de 3 à 5 ans d'expérience pertinente dans le domaine des transports, du matériel roulant, de l’électrification des transports ou d’un domaine connexe.· Membre de l’OIQ ou pouvoir le devenir.· Connaissance approfondie des normes entourant le matériel roulant telles que IEEE, EN, CENELEC et MIL.· Connaissance pratique des systèmes ferroviaires, des autobus, des camions, ainsi que des normes de sécurité applicables à ces domaines.· Bon jugement, organisé(e), capacité d'analyse et de résolution de problèmes.· Compétences en rédaction technique. Bilinguisme (anglais et français) à l’oral et à l’écrit.· Bon esprit d’équipe et sens de l’initiative, proactif; débrouillard, autonome et flexible;· Solide expertise dans la conception et l'intégration de systèmes complexes;· Solide expérience en intégration de systèmes;· Expérience avec la méthode Agile.Nous offrons : Il s’agit d’un poste permanent à temps plein (40 heures/semaine). Un horaire réduit est envisageable selon vos besoins. Nous offrons des avantages sociaux (assurances de groupe), un salaire compétitif et des horaires flexibles. Le télétravail peut faire partie de votre horaire, même après la pandémie.À propos de Technologies CyscaTECHNOLOGIES CYSCA est une firme d’ingénierie qui offre plusieurs services d’ingénierie, de développement de produits, de développement logiciel et de conception de produits électroniques. Nos domaines d’application sont aussi variés que les transports, l’aérospatiale, la robotique, l’intelligence artificielle, la sécurité, l’exploitation minière, l’emballage, l’éclairage et la défense. Notre équipe est constituée de plus de 50 professionnels, ingénieurs, programmeurs, concepteurs et techniciens, dévoués au développement et à la conception de produits de hautes technologies.Type d'emploi : Temps Plein, PermanentSalaire : 60 000,00$ à 80 000,00$ par anAvantages :Assurance DentaireAssurance Maladie ComplémentaireREER CollectifHoraire :8 HeuresFormation:DEC (Souhaité)Télétravail:Oui

Damon Motors

Damon is an award-winning electric motorcycle manufacturer founded in 2017 by serial entrepreneurs & avid motorcyclists, Jay Giraud and Dom Kwong. Damon is dedicated to building the future of motorcycling. Our vision is one of smarter, safer, more exhilarating, and more personal riding experiences.
Designed for performance, every Damon motorcycle is powered by HyperDrive™, the world’s first all-electric multi-variant powertrain platform. Additionally, they are fitted with our proprietary on-the-fly adjustable ergonomics technology, Shift™, and 360° Advanced Warning System for Motorcycles (AWSM™). We're the first to use deep technology & AI, so that with every ride a Damon bike evolves to more tightly understand the rider.
We are looking to add a Junior Hardware Design Engineer to the Damon team - if you are ready to push beyond the limits & do your best work - we want to hear from YOU!
Position Overview:

As a Junior Hardware Design Engineer, you will be responsible for design, development, prototype and test for Damon’s family of safety and powered EV bikes. Focus in this role is on "high tech" rather than drivetrain products. You will work with the team to bring designs from the concept and architecture stage through to production.


Duties & Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

Design and development.
Component selection, schematic entry, PCB layout, manufacturing documentation.
Validation and characterization tests for various components of the system, the system as well as the complete motorcycle.
Perform part selection, procurement and co-ordinate assembly of electronic prototypes.
Assist in additional electro-mechanical fabrication activities related to product research and development.
Debug and perform root cause analysis on damaged products and prototypes.
Test and resolve EMC issues.


Requirements:

Bachelor’s or Master's Degree in Electrical Engineering or equivalent industry experience.
Proficient use of electronic testing equipment and design tools.
Min 3 years experience in high tech and / or automotive design and development.
Familiar with Altium or equivalent PCB Design software.
Good technical background with the ability to learn new concepts and skills.
Ability to work well with others, including HW team management and cross discipline communications.
Positive attitude and good work ethic.
Safety conscious and compliant to company standard procedures.
Ability to self-manage time and tasks.
Create comprehensive and complete documentation.


Additional Beneficial Skills:

Programming or scripting experience.
Selection and bring-up of cameras including MIPI and ethernet based.
Antenna characterization and tuning.
High speed SERDES knowledge.
Motor control experience.
CAN Bus, Radar, Wireless Communications (BT, Wifi, 4G, 5G) knowledge.
ISO-26262 familiarity.
Familiarity with PLC process and PLM tools.
Version control systems.
VHDL and FPGA experience.
A motorcycle license or interest in obtaining a license is an asset, but not required.


Benefits

Dental care
Extended health care
Travel Benefits
Paid time off
Vision care
Wellness program
Optional Motorcycle Riding school
Supportive work environment
Training & Development Program


 To apply, please complete an application via our website https://damon.com/careers

OPAL-RT Technologies recherche un Spécialiste en tests de systèmes intégrés
À propos d’OPAL-RT Technologies
Imaginez travailler pour une entreprise qui compte parmi ses clients la NASA, Bombardier, ABB, EMBRAER, MIT, GE, Ford, GM, NREL, RIVIAN et Hydro-Québec! OPAL-RT s’est donné comme ambitieux défi de démocratiser la simulation temps réel afin de la rendre accessible à chaque ingénieur et chercheur. En rejoignant le clan des OPALIENS, vous contribuerez à la technologie du futur.
Leader mondial dans la diversité des applications, nos outils sont utilisés dans une multitude de secteurs tels que l'automobile, l'aérospatiale, l’énergie, le transport, la fabrication industrielle, etc. Fondée au Québec et maintenant assurée par une présence mondiale, OPAL-RT a le vent dans les voiles!
Dépassement et défis stimulants :
Relevant du Chef d’équipe en intégration de systèmes personnalisés, vous participerez aux tests des solutions électriques et électroniques intégrant les produits de la compagnie, de compagnies tierces et ceux des clients. Les produits finaux de notre équipe sont des solutions de tests complètes sur mesure permettant à nos clients de valider les designs matériels et embarqués de leurs systèmes de contrôle. Comme exemples de projets dont vous réaliserez les tests, notons des bancs pour tester des ordinateurs de contrôle de moteurs d’avion, de contrôle de solution 100% électrique ou hybride dans les navires, véhicules roulants, etc.
Nous cherchons une personne passionnée du domaine électrique, électronique et des technologies nouvelles.
Principales responsabilités :

Effectuer les tests avant livraison des solutions électriques et électroniques intégrant les produits existants d’OPAL-RT et de National Instrument en fonction des besoins et des critères des clients.
Effectuer la rédaction ou la mise à jour des procédures de tests intégrés en fonction des besoins et des critères des clients.
Concevoir des modèles MATLAB/Simulink en fonction des besoins et des critères des clients.
Concevoir des modèles VeriStand/LabVIEW en fonction des besoins et des critères des clients.

Réaliser le déverminage des systèmes et des modèles conçus.
Mettre à jour la documentation technique des solutions et des modèles incluant B.O.M. et dessins techniques.

Installer les systèmes chez les clients dans un contexte mondial.
Concevoir des circuits électroniques de base.


Exigences :

Scolarité : Baccalauréat en génie électrique, génie mécanique ou l’équivalent;
Expérience : Minimum 3 ans d’expérience pertinente en électronique et signaux, expérience pertinente d’analyse de cahier de spécifications, expérience en rédaction technique, expérience en tests;
Connaissances requises (atouts): MATLAB/Simulink, Microsoft Visio, IGE-XAO SEE Electrical Expert, NI LabVIEW, NI VeriStand, connaissances de la technologie FPGA;
Connaissances linguistiques : Bonne maîtrise du français et de l’anglais;
Savoir-être : Autonomie, bonne communication interpersonnelle, flexibilité et adaptation, capacité d’analyse, rigueur, détermination, satisfaction du client, souci de la qualité du travail, capacité à travailler en équipe et sens de l’organisation.


Une carrière chez OPAL-RT vous conviendra si :

Vous recherchez des défis stimulants qui vous pousseront à vous dépasser sans cesse.
Vous rêvez d’une ambiance à la fois familiale, professionnelle, collaborative et conviviale.
Vous avez besoin d’un horaire flexible et l’accès au télétravail afin de concilier votre vie privée à votre vie professionnelle.
Vous souhaitez parfaire vos connaissances et votre savoir-faire en côtoyant des chercheurs, des innovateurs, des scientifiques qui ont tous un point en commun, la Passion.
Vous avez fait le choix d’être un collaborateur important pour l’avancement technologique d’une multitude d’industries.
Vous désirez être considéré pour vos idées, votre créativité et vos talents.
Vous connaissez votre valeur et recherchez une rémunération globale concurrentielle.
Vous ne voulez pas un simple emploi, vous voulez une carrière!
