OPAL-RT Technologies is looking for an Integrated systems testing specialist
About OPAL-RT Technologies


Imagine working for a company whose clients include NASA, Bombardier, ABB, EMBRAER, MIT, GE, Ford, GM, NREL, RIVIAN and Hydro-Québec! OPAL-RT has set itself the ambitious challenge of democratizing real-time simulation to make it accessible to every engineer and researcher. By joining the clan of OPALIANS, you will contribute to the technology of the future.


World leader in the diversity of applications, our tools are used in a multitude of sectors such as automotive, aerospace, energy, transportation, industrial manufacturing, etc. Founded in Quebec and now assured by a worldwide presence, OPAL-RT has the wind in its sails!


Stimulating challenges:
Reporting to the Custom Systems Integration Team Leader, you will participate in the testing of electrical and electronic solutions including the company, third party and customer products. The end products of our team are complete custom test solutions that allow our customers to validate the hardware and embedded designs of their control systems. Examples of projects that you will test include test benches for aircraft engine control computers, control of 100% electric or hybrid solutions in ships, rolling vehicles, etc.

We are looking for someone who is passionate about the electrical, electronic field and new technologies.
Your main responsibilities:

Perform pre-delivery testing of electrical and electronic solutions integrating existing OPAL-RT and National Instrument products based on customer needs and criteria.
Write or update integrated test procedures based on customer requirements and criteria.
Design MATLAB/Simulink models based on customer requirements and criteria.
Design VeriStand/LabVIEW models based on customer requirements and criteria.

Carry out the debugging of the systems and models designed.
Update technical documentation of solutions and models including B.O.M. and technical drawings.

Install systems at customer sites in a global context.
Design basic electronic circuits.


Requirements:


Education: Bachelor's degree in Electrical, Mechanical Engineering or equivalent;
Experience: Minimum 3 years of relevant experience in electronics and signals, relevant experience in specification analysis, experience in technical writing, experience in testing;
Required knowledge (assets): MATLAB/Simulink, Microsoft Visio, IGE-XAO SEE Electrical Expert, NI LabVIEW, NI VeriStand, knowledge of FPGA technology;
Language abilities: Good command of French and English;
Soft skills : Autonomy, good interpersonal communication, flexibility and adaptability, analytical skills, rigor, determination, customer satisfaction, concern for the quality of work, ability to work in a team and organizational skills.


A career with OPAL-RT will suit you if:


You are looking for stimulating challenges that will push you to constantly surpass yourself.
You dream of an atmosphere that is at once family-oriented, professional, collaborative and friendly.
You need a flexible schedule and access to telecommuting in order to balance your personal and professional life.
You wish to perfect your knowledge and know-how by working with researchers, innovators and scientists who all have one thing in common: passion.
You have made the choice to be an important contributor to the technological advancement of a multitude of industries.
You want to be considered for your ideas, creativity and talents.
You know your value and are looking for a competitive total compensation package.
You don't just want a job, you want a career!

OSCPS Motion Sensing Inc., is looking for an Electro-Photonics expert with experience in sensing technologies and more specifically, accelerometers and gyroscopes. ABOUT GRAYMONT

Graymont is a global leader in lime and limestone solutions. Our products are essential in addressing today’s most pressing environmental issues while supporting vital industrial processes and agricultural needs. Uses for our products include the purification of air and water, and the production of items essential to a modern economy such as steel, paper, and metals. Headquartered in Canada, Graymont serves markets throughout North America and Asia-Pacific. Graymont is also the strategic partner of Mexican-based Grupo Calidra, the largest lime producer in Latin America.
Professionally managed and family owned, the company has been in operation for over 70 years. Graymont aims to be the preferred supplier, employer, and partner of choice wherever we operate.
Graymont’s growing business focuses on technology and innovation. POSITION SUMMARY

Reporting to the Remote Operations Supervisor, the Remote Operations Engineers and Specialists are responsible for monitoring and controlling company assets in a centralized remote operations center (ROC). The team’s aim is to increase efficiency and product quality in lime calcination processes through the use of cutting-edge technology and automation. The Remote Operator fills a crucial role in ensuring safe & continuous operation, product quality, and compliance with environmental requirements by collaborating with plant-based personnel and other Remote Operations based out of our ROC in Salt Lake City, Utah.
To be successful in this role, you must have an in-depth understanding of how process changes affect plant operations and product quality, along with the ability to analyze trends and data to make process decisions. You must also be comfortable monitoring multiple processes and prioritizing alarms. You will be responsible for service requests and committed to finding ways to optimize operations.
DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES :

Monitor and control plant production equipment at multiple geographic locations simultaneously in a safe manner. Make process adjustments in response to, and in anticipation of operational and quality needs.
Monitor product quality throughout the process, collaborating with onsite technicians and making decisions required to maintain product quality.
Apply knowledge gained to define problems, establish facts, and determine valid conclusions to drive process efficiencies and improvements.
Maintain shift operation records and exchange information with others during shift changes or otherwise as necessary.
Actively collaborate with peers and other departments to ensure the highest standards in safety, environmental performance, quality, and efficiency are achieved.
Shift work: 12 hours rotating shifts between day shift and night shift to maintain 24 hour operations. Holiday and weekend coverage is required.
Communicate with onsite operations personnel, maintenance technicians, supervisors, process engineers and others to coordinate production and quality requirements.
Collaborate on various special projects to continuously improve the remote operations program.
Identify, develop, continuously improve, and communicate the best available process practices within Graymont.
Stay up to date with the latest technological developments in related industries.
Work with Graymont’s Process Engineering Group and plant process engineers to continuously expand and improve the automation strategy.
Assist various departments and functional groups to investigate and find the root cause of problems.
Must be willing to work extended hours as necessary to meet urgent deadlines or to ensure resolution of problems.
Occasional travel required – up to 20%. Travel throughout the US and Canada.
QUALIFICATIONS :

Minimum of 2 years of industrial experience in a manufacturing or processing environment is preferred.
Must be fluent in both English and French.
Must be able to read and interpret electronic data and make appropriate decisions related to processing equipment.
Superior analytical and problem-solving skills. Pursues innovative solutions when and where appropriate.
Excellent critical thinking skills with the ability to analyze complex problems and implement solutions in a short timeframe.
Able to effectively build relationships with employees at all levels within the organization (front line to executive management).
Strong organizational skills and ability to manage multiple priorities. Self-directed and highly motivated requiring minimal direct guidance.
Demonstrated ability to work effectively in a team environment.
Strong active listening skills in addition to strong oral and written communication skills. Must, need to be able to communicate clearly & effectively to (both technical and non-technical stakeholders).
Post-secondary education with an engineering degree or technical certification is considered and asset.
Excellent computer skills and knowledge of Microsoft programs.
Electrical, PLC programming, instrumentation, automation, and HMI controls background will be considered a strong asset.

Position Summary:
The Manufacturing Engineer will report to the Manager, Manufacturing Engineering and will be responsible for offering technical and operational support to the Photon Control Production and Product Development Teams. The Manufacturing Engineer will work in close co-operation with these cross-functional teams to ensure successful transfer and commercialization of New Products (NPI) into production, support existing production processes, new technology acquisitions and drive continuous improvement to enable the organization to meet delivery, lead time and quality objectives
Key Responsibilities:
Assist in failure and root cause analysis investigations (NC/CA, FA, etc.) and, when required, execute effective, practical, controlled corrective action to eliminate future re-occurrence on the production floor.
Apply advanced problem-solving methodology such as DMAIC, 8D analysis etc. to identify effective solutions to complex issues with unknown root causes.
Design jigs, fixtures and tooling using CAD (SolidWorks) to provide solutions to the production floor.
Implement and manage continuous improvement by highlighting deficiencies and recommending changes in training, working practices, business processes and ERP systems to eliminate waste and enhance value.
Assist and train operators in improvement methods such as kaizens, 5S, visual management etc.
Support the Process Reliability team with equipment maintenance, verification and calibration duties as required.
Write and edit technical documentation to enable controlled implementation of any changes to release products following the established validation.
Lead Design for Manufacture (DFM) & Design for Assembly (DFA) efforts on engineering programs and provide feedback to the design team on improvement during design reviews.
Apply ‘build-in quality’ tools in the NPI stage including PFMEA, Control Plans, Process Flow and product/process requirements.
Able and willing to carry out any other duties and projects as required by the company.
Qualifications and Skills Required:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Engineering in Mechanical, Manufacturing, Mechatronics or Industrial Engineering or related area of applied science.
Minimum 3-5 years of progressive experience in a similar manufacturing or industrial engineering role. Preferably electronics manufacturing (Copy Exact) environments
Lean Six Sigma training is required. Green Belt certification preferred.
Experience in the use and application of ‘build-in quality’ tools such as FMEA, QCP, MSA, etc.
Competence in Solidworks or equivalent CAD software, application of geometric dimensioning and tolerancing (GD&T)
Knowledge in PPAP / APQP and associated ‘build-in quality’ tools such as FMEA, QCP, MSA, etc.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving skills, with strong attention to details
Excellent communication and technical written skills
Flexible and willing to work in very fast-paced environment where tasks and priorities may change often.
Professional Engineer (P.Eng.) or other related professional designation an asset

OPAL-RT Technologies recherche un Assembleur mécanique et électrique (Temporaire - 6 mois)
À propos d’OPAL-RT Technologies :
Imaginez travailler pour une entreprise qui compte parmi ses clients la NASA, Bombardier, ABB, EMBRAER, MIT, GE, Ford, GM, NREL et Hydro-Québec! OPAL-RT s’est donné comme ambitieux défi de démocratiser la simulation temps réel afin de la rendre accessible à chaque ingénieur et chercheur. En rejoignant le clan des OPALIENS, vous contribuerez à la technologie du futur.

Leader mondial dans la diversité des applications, nos outils sont utilisés dans une multitude de secteurs tels que l'automobile, l'aérospatiale, l’énergie, le transport, la fabrication industrielle, etc. Fondée au Québec et maintenant assurée par une présence mondiale, OPAL-RT a le vent dans les voiles!
Sommaire du poste :
Sous la supervision du chef d’équipe en production, le titulaire du poste participe à l’assemblage des pièces et des composants électriques et mécaniques (PC, simulateurs). Le candidat recherché doit être autodidacte et capable de lire des plans électroniques et mécaniques.
Vous apprendrez plusieurs aspects de l’assemblage sur des projets diversifiés de la simulation temps réel, dans tous les domaines: électronique de puissance, automobile, aéronautique, moteurs électriques, etc.
Principales responsabilités :
Assemblage (80%) et Montage (20%):
Assembler des systèmes électroniques et électriques.Souder et monter manuellement divers composants électroniques, tels que des conducteurs de résistance, des diodes, des transistors, des condensateurs, des circuits intégrés, des commutateurs, des fils et d’autres pièces électroniques, à des points précis sur des plaquettes de circuits imprimés.Monter des microcircuits qui demandent de la dextérité en utilisant des microscopes.Fabriquer, installer et ajuster des composants, du câblage et des étriers aux ensembles et sous-ensembles à l’aide d’outils manuels.Effectuer des micros-soudures et réparer de cartes électroniques.
Exigences :
Scolarité : Diplôme d’études secondaires ou DEP en mécanique ou électromécanique;Expérience : 3-5 ans minimum en assemblage de pièces mécaniques et électriques ou une formation faite à l’École des métiers de l’aérospatiale de Montréal (EMAM).Connaissances requises : Connaissances en électrique (mapping box) et en mécanique, connaissances sur les PC, maîtrise des outils d’assemblage (fer à soudure, multimètre, perceuse, visseuse, etc.)Connaissances linguistiques : Bonne maîtrise du français et de l’anglais;Compétences recherchées : Bonne dextérité manuelle, rigueur et détermination, autonomie.
Une carrière chez OPAL-RT vous conviendra si :

Vous recherchez des défis stimulants qui vous pousseront à vous dépasser sans cesse.Vous rêvez d’une ambiance à la fois familiale, professionnelle, collaborative et conviviale.Vous avez besoin d’un horaire flexible afin de concilier votre vie privée à votre vie professionnelle.Vous souhaitez parfaire vos connaissances et votre savoir-faire en côtoyant des chercheurs, des innovateurs, des scientifiques qui ont tous un point en commun, la Passion.Vous avez fait le choix d’être un collaborateur important pour l’avancement technologie d’une multitude d’industries.Vous désirez être considéré pour vos idées, votre créativité et vos talents.Vous connaissez votre valeur et recherchez une rémunération globale concurrentielle.Vous ne voulez pas un simple emploi, vous voulez une carrière et faire une vraie différence!
Note: L'utilisation du genre masculin inclut le féminin et est utilisé uniquement pour faciliter la lecture.

About US
In 1977, OSI introduced the first generation electronic chart system for the maritime market and revolutionized navigation. Over the years we have had many firsts. Today, OSI Maritime Systems is a leading provider of integrated navigation and tactical solutions designed for naval and maritime security operations. Among those solutions, the company develops and delivers integrated bridge systems for warships, integrated dived navigation systems for submarines, and C2 systems for small craft. Presently, 23 navies totaling more than 600 warships and submarines operate using OSI systems.

Due to the nature of our company, all employees must pass specific security criteria. Only candidates who are Canadian citizens, have PR status or have a citizenship from a NATO country, and who satisfy security clearance criteria, will be considered.
The Job
The Component Engineer is responsible for maintaining OSI’s parts and components in the PDX database and providing parts and components information to internal stakeholders as requested.

The main responsibilities include:
Generating technical specifications on all Commercial-Off-The-Shelf devices for the product database
Comparing component specifications, making recommendations for 2nd source qualification
Component/product functional evaluation and testing
Ensuring component suitability by creating and reviewing where used reports
Analyzing End of Life (EOL) and Product Change Notices (PCN) notes, flagging obsolete parts, writing CR/CN’s when required
Identifying new potential suppliers for components
Creating new part information data and entry into the OSI database
Maintaining part information data for existing parts in the OSI database
Checking components' approval, and certifications
Recommending risk buying for recent discontinuation or EOL
Providing product technical support within the OSI organization
Validating that the product can either be manufactured or purchased
Classifying the product as per the OSI classification scheme
Identifying critical components to be monitored for EOL and PCN notices
Making recommendations on parts to be made obsolete
Making recommendations for replacements of obsolete parts
You Bring:
Engineering degree or Technology diploma
Experience with specifying and sourcing of mechanical, electric and electronic components
Experience with the application of products and components in marine navigation systems an asset
Experience reading various IEC/ISO/MIL standards an asset

LIFE AT BRP

We create innovative ways to move – on snow, water, asphalt. In the air, on the ground and everywhere in between.

Built on a 75-year tradition of ingenuity and intensive customer focus, BRP is headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec and operates manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, and Austria. We have a total workforce of more than 14 500 driven, resourceful people.

Our portfolio of industry-leading and distinctive products includes Ski-Doo and Lynx snowmobiles, Sea-Doo watercraft, Can-Am on- and off-road vehicles, Alumacraft, Manitou, Quintrex, Stacer and Savage boats, Evinrude and Rotax marine propulsion systems as well as Rotax engines for karts, motorcycles and recreational aircraft. We support our lines of product with a dedicated parts, accessories and clothing business to fully enhance your riding experience.

Because it’s not about the destination. It’s about the journey. Yours.

We are passionate and qualified; by joining BRP, you will evolve within an experienced team that will welcome you with open arms.

www.brp.com.

WHY JOIN THE TEAM?

To work in the field of recreational product development

To be part of a dynamic. passionate and motivated team

To have an opportunity to be creative and innovative and to influence technical orientations in the field of motorsports

YOUR KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

As a member of the BRP engine calibration development team, you will report to the calibration team manager and work under the supervision of an engineer. You will be responsible for:

Working on mapping and on calibration strategies for the powertrain management system (injection/ignition) with the goal of optimizing performance, polluting emissions, fuel economy and ride quality

Participating in engine optimization tests on chassis and engine dynamometers

Participating in vehicle testing in different conditions (cold, heat, altitude, etc.)

Diagnosing system malfunctions and reactions on the vehicle

Establishing calibration methodologies to reduce development time and increase the strength of calibrations

Collaborating on engine and transmission development for our products

YOUR QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS

Diploma of College Studies (DEC) in mechanical engineering, physics, robotics or another related technical field

Relevant experience in engine calibration and development considered an asset

Excellent understanding of engine and transmission operation

Skills in using electronic and computerized calibration tools (ETAS Inca, Morphée, CRETA, etc.)

Technical and operational knowledge of electronic engine management systems

Expertise of engine mapping, calibration strategy (reduction of polluting emissions, performance) and exhaust treatment (catalytic converter)

Knowledge of physics and electromechanics

Awareness of modern four-stroke engine technologies

Mechanical skills and a practical nature

Good level of English to communicate with an international team

Very keen interest in motorsports and recreative products

WELCOME TO BRP

We’re a world leader in recreational vehicles and boats, creating innovative ways to move on snow, water, asphalt, dirt and even in the air. Headquartered in the Canadian town of Valcourt, Quebec, our company is rooted in a spirit of ingenuity and intense customer focus. Today, we operate manufacturing facilities in Canada, the United States, Mexico, Finland, Australia and Austria, with a workforce of over 14,500 spirited people, all driven by the deeply held belief that at work, as with life itself, it’s not about the destination; It’s about the journey. We’re fueled by a pioneering spirit that carries us beyond. And together we enable highly skilled people to continually push boundaries and tackle big challenges requiring solutions that endure and inspire.

Are you ready to launch the next stage of your career in the new space economy? We would love to hear from you!

We’re on the hunt for a Product Assurance Manager on our Satellite systems team at our Montreal office.

As the leading global independent commercial supplier of antennas, payloads, and electronics for communication and radar satellites, our team has successfully contributed to hundreds of missions in the past 60 years. With an extensive heritage in a wide range of solutions delivered to customers globally, our Satellite Systems team continues to grow and evolve on the ground and in the stars.

We’re a dream team of purpose-driven, collaborative and passionate people, and we are constantly looking for others to join #TeamMDA to ignite new and innovative approaches to problem-solving that push us forward to improve life on and above Earth. If you’re excited to expand our place in space and driven to inspire the next generation, we’ll take you there.

We have entered a new era of exploration and development, and MDA welcomes all who yearn to suit up and be part of it. An equal opportunity employer prizing diversity, integrity and collaboration, we are committed to growing MDA’s and Canada’s leadership in this next golden age.


Role:
The position is responsible for ensuring that the program's products and services meet contractual and divisional quality requirements.


Tasks:

Participate in product design by reviewing drawings and engineering change notices;
Ensure compliance with specifications by reviewing and approving work instructions, processes and inspection points on production orders. Provide interpretations of acceptance criteria and optimize the control plan;
Coordinate problem resolution and corrective action upon detection of non-conformances with purchasing, production, design and other engineering disciplines;
Conduct process and product compliance audits both internally and at suppliers. Ensure effective corrective actions;
Analyze data and performance indicators, identify improvement potentials and lead continuous improvement projects.
A bachelor's degree in engineering with an interest in the manufacturing of complex machined parts, electromechanical assemblies or PCB printed circuit boards. Ability to exercise leadership in one's discipline.
Good communicator in both English and French. Have a spirit of collaboration and teamwork.
Knowledge of dimensioning and geometric tolerancing (ASME Y14.5), AS 9100 quality standards and aerospace work standards is also a requirement of the position.
Computer skills (word processing and electronic calculation applications) are also required.


Preferred Qualifications:

Auditor training;
Training in quality engineering and/or continuous improvement (APQP, CQE, Six sigma, etc.);
Training in SQL, C# or web language.

An Opportunity to Join Our Dynamic Team … in a Dynamic City
The Corporation of the City of St. Thomas -

Planning & Building Services Department has a position for a:

DEPUTY CHIEF BUILDING OFFICIAL

(Permanent, Full-Time)
St. Thomas is a community growing in size and strength and is home to about 40,000 people. Conveniently located close to Port Stanley, London, and Highway 401, it's the perfect location in Southwestern Ontario. With a rich heritage but a modern atmosphere, there is nowhere better to thrive than St. Thomas.
POSITION SUMMARY:
This non-union position, under the general direction of the Chief Building Official, administers the implementation and enforcement of Provincial Statutes and Regulations, as they apply to buildings, structures, and their occupancy. Assists in the administration of the interpretation and enforcement of the Zoning By-Law, the Property Standards By-Law and other By-Laws relating to the use of buildings or lands. Reviews permit applications and issues permits when plans and supporting documents are complete. Inspects buildings and structures, existing or new, ensuring compliance with applicable regulations. Supervises and assists with the coordination of the staff and activities of the Building Services Section and acts as the Chief Building Official in his/her absence.
MAJOR TASKS:
Assumes the duties and responsibilities of the Chief Building Official in his/her absence.
In accordance with statutory requirements, is responsible for the enforcement of Provincial Statutes and Regulations thereunder the Ontario Building Code, and all other applicable Laws as they apply to buildings and structures.
Participates in the Supervision of all plan examinations, the issuance of all building permits, establishment and collection of fees and levies; the issuance of other permits, licences and legal documents issued to the public.
Monitors the electronic permit database system to ensure input consistency and validity of information being entered and assists with the implementation of electronic plans examination and permit processing standards.

Participates in the selection and hiring of employees
Appraises the performance and conduct of employees
Recommends the promotion, demotion, discipline and termination of employees
Schedules and/or grants sick and annual leave
Encourages and assists in maintaining a high standard of morale
Ensures operations and practices are consistent with the terms of any Collective Agreement and/or By-Law and that the Administration of such Agreement and/or By-Law is carried out.
Informs permit applicants, design consultants, professional engineers, architects, builders, property owners, project managers and building inspectors of any discrepancies discovered during plan examinations and requests all necessary changes to plans, submissions and other additional information required for complete review.
Consults with prospective permit applicants and the general public with respect to the requirements of the Ontario Building Code (both technical and general) and Departmental requirements as an aid in the planning, design, construction and permit application processes.
Interprets and gives direction (in consultation with the CBO) on the City’s Development Charges By-Law to determine if the proposed development is subject to development charges and collects the appropriate development fee. Reviews the construction value for the proposed work and places a value on the work if required to ensure compliance with the City’s Building By-Law. Supervises the collection of all fees under the jurisdiction of the Building Services Section.
Ensures that the policies and objectives for the Building Services Area are met.
In accordance with the Ontario Building Code, assists with the preparation of an annual report for public viewing regarding building permit fees authorized and costs to the City to administer and enforce the Ontario Building Code Act within the City boundaries.
Conducts building, plumbing and zoning inspections and maintains records of various stages in the process, for all types and nature of construction (residential, commercial, institutional and industrial).
Responds to directives from the CBO, senior management or City Council in a prompt manner and provides for the issuance of applicable reports as required.
Supports staff with the enforcement and interpretation of the provisions of the Zoning By-law as they apply to the use and occupancy of any building or lands.
Provides information to support and assist in the decision-making process of the Committee of Adjustment and also the Site Plan Control Committee.
Ensures that any building/development is in full compliance with Official Plan, Zoning, Subdivision Agreements and Site Plan Agreements.
Maintains the confidentiality of information acquired in the course of the review of building proposals.
Writes and issues Ontario Building Code orders to comply when a contravention to the regulations is found and follows up by re-inspecting.

Reviews approved plans for on-site inspection purposes. Interprets and explains procedures of inspections and gives verbal and written approvals for various stages of construction as completed.
Responds to written and verbal inquiries with respect to construction and issues Certificate of Compliance/Non-compliance.
Meets with owners, contractors, consultants and professionals as required to settle disputes, grievances and to provide expert advice.
Assists the City Solicitor to prepare for court action. Represents the City at relevant legal proceedings or special hearings and attends the Committee of Adjustments meetings in an advisory capacity.
Reviews building permit applications and issues permits for on-site sewage systems in accordance with Part 8 of the Ontario Building Code and conducts field inspections.
Responds to City Police Department request to attend and inspects known marijuana grow-houses to determine if building is safe for occupancy. Assists Police as requested to ensure safety of building prior to their entry.
Provides technical support to City Fire Department, attends fire scenes as requested, and participates in joint inspections.
Remains informed and up-to-date with all Code changes and new methods and innovative materials as they apply to construction.
Ensures the creation and maintenance of accurate records for the Service Area, including but not limited to: inspections made, conditions noted, orders issued and any such other records as may be required.
Provides support with the preparation of an annual operating budget for the Service Area.
This position must be compliant with all provisions of the Occupational Health and Safety Act, related to “Duties of a Supervisor” and “Duties of a Worker”.
Performs such other related duties as may be assigned.
QUALIFICATIONS:

Minimum three (3) year Post Secondary School Diploma in Civil Engineering and/or Architectural Technology together with five (5) years experience in a related field or an equivalent combination of education, training and experience in the building industry. Must possess and demonstrate a working knowledge of Building & Plumbing & Fire Regulations and have passed the examination program administered or authorized by the Ontario Ministry of Municipal Affairs and Housing (Building and Development Branch) relating to the powers and duties of Chief Building Official and the categories of qualification set out in Division C of the Ontario Building Code. Must have experience working in or with the municipal sector and excellent communication skills and the ability to interact with the public, contractors, consultants, Council Members and City staff in a professional manner. Must have a strong work ethic with the ability to work independently or with a team. Must have excellent computer skills utilizing Microsoft Office and electronic permit systems. Must have or obtain the C.B.C.O. designation. Must have physical capability to carry out duties with the position classification (i.e. climb ladders, walk over rough terrain, enter confined spaces). Must have or be eligible for membership in the Ontario Building Officials Association (O.B.O.A.). Must be competent within the meaning of the Occupational Health & Safety Act. Must be capable of issuing clearly understandable written instructions.
CONDITIONS OF EMPLOYMENT:

May be required to work outside and beyond the normal hours of work. A valid Ontario Driver’s licence and the use of a privately owned vehicle are required.


Remuneration Range: $42.45 - $53.01 per hour (2020 rate) working a 40 hour work week ($88,296 - $110,261 per annum) plus a comprehensive benefit package. Note: Remuneration is under review.


Applications must be received no later than Wednesday December 15, 2021.

Job Description:

As a Systems Engineer, you will contribute to the System Design Team of the Evolve to Open (EvO) programme responsible for developing the next generation of Tactical Communications and Information System (TacCIS) for the UK Ministry of Defence. You will contribute to the specification, design, development, and validation of solutions for EvO, and be responsible for the delivery of a robust System Design addressing the particular interests of stakeholders, whilst also describing the specific aspects of the system to inform the Product level design.
Our first and foremost priority remains the health and safety of our colleagues. As a result, this role will be working remotely for the foreseeable future. The primary location of this role is Calgary.
The duties of the Systems Engineer include the following:
Requirements Analysis.
Use Case development.
Functional and feature specification.
Elaboration of designs.
Liaise with cross functional teams to develop and deliver working solutions.
You will bring to the team your significant experience of deriving design artefacts (such as use cases, sequence diagrams and specifications), at the System-Level, within a large Defence project.
Basic Qualifications:

Education/Training:
Bachelor's degree in Electrical/Electronics or related technical/scientific degree.
Required experience is as follows:
Minimum 5 years Systems Engineering experience of complex software solutions.
Minimum 5 years experience in requirements development and system design.
Experience with Trade Studies and Design to Cost (DTC).
Experience working in multi-disciplinary teams.
Experience supporting System Integration and System Qualification.
Experience in planning, estimating and scheduling.

Company Description
Microchip Technology Inc. is a leading provider of embedded control applications. Our product portfolio comprises general purpose and specialized 8-bit, 16-bit, and 32-bit microcontrollers, 32-bit microprocessors, field-programmable gate array (FPGA) products, a broad spectrum of high-performance linear, mixed-signal, power management, thermal management, radio frequency (RF), timing, safety, security, wired connectivity and wireless connectivity devices, as well as serial Electrically Erasable Programmable Read Only Memory (EEPROM), Serial Flash memories, Parallel Flash memories, and serial Static Random Access Memory (SRAM). We also license Flash-IP solutions that are incorporated in a broad range of products.
Job Description
Microchip is currently looking for a Senior System Validation Design Engineer to join our Communications Business Unit in Burnaby, BC, Canada.
Microchip’s Communications Business Unit (CBU) is a premier supplier for 100Gbps+ Optical Networking & Connectivity Solutions for Telecom & Hyperscale Data Center Networks. Our devices enable high-bandwidth, cloud-based applications such as streaming services, social media platforms and video conferencing.
The CBU System Validation team is a dynamic and multi-talented group responsible for the design, integration, and validation of an entire hardware and software system required for SoC functional validation. The System Validation team works in close collaboration with the Product Development and Software teams to design, integrate and validate an entire system solution for semiconductors targeting telecom or datacom networking applications. The team ensures that end products operate fully in their intended applications.
As a Senior Engineer in the CBU System Validation team you will be responsible for a wide variety of tasks including board designs, FW coding, FPGA code development, tester designs, Python script coding, and software driver/OS system level integration. You will also work closely with a wide range of communications protocols, including OTN, Ethernet, high-speed SERDES and PCI Express. Using these systems, together with the latest protocol analyzers and test equipment, the System Validation Design Engineer will work as part of a team to develop and execute a Feature Test Plan that fully exercises the prototype IC and associated FW/SW.
As a member of this team, you must be highly motivated to learn, have first-class debugging and problem-solving skills, be motivated to develop sophisticated hardware and software platforms, and be able to quickly master the devices and systems that Microchip develops.
The role of the Senior System Validation Design Engineer includes:
Design high-speed Validation boards (50 GHz +) using Microchip and third-party ICs, digital and analog circuits, and large programmable devices.
Design highly-integrated, sophisticated FPGAs and CPLDs using VHDL/Verilog.
Integrate complex test platforms containing CPUs, high speed backplanes, traffic generation boards, software, and our Validation boards.
Plan and execute device feature tests, including results analysis, bug detection, and extensive root-cause analysis.
Integrate software SDK to control the hardware systems we developed.
Develop application level Python scripts for automated control of the device under test, the test platform, and the test equipment.
Troubleshoot and resolve complex problems in embedded multi-core SOCs for communications applications.
Work closely with and support members of the Product Design, Software, Verification, Applications, Marketing, and Production Engineering teams.
Job RequirementsYou have a Bachelor’s or Master’s Degree in Electrical and/or Computer Engineering.
You have 5 to 10 years of relevant work experience.
You want to be part of an exciting, dynamic, and challenging work environment, requiring rapid and constant learning and skills development.
You have a systematic approach to problem-solving within a team and on your own. When something isn’t working properly, it’s important to you to figure out why.
You have excellent analytical, communication, and documentation skills.
You have experience with designing sophisticated electronic hardware and systems.
You have experience with FPGAs, CPLDs and VHDL/Verilog design.
You have experience with scripting languages like Python or Perl.
You have experience with C driver API development (an asset).
You have experience with Principles of uProcessor architecture (an asset).
You have used a variety of test equipment in a lab environment.
You are familiar with Linux operating systems.

Embedded Software Engineer

Turntide Technologies is helping turn the tide on climate change with breakthrough technologies that accelerate electrification and sustainable operations for energy-intensive industries. We develop full-stack, integrated, open systems that support commercial and industrial electric vehicles, building operations, and agriculture to optimize how the world uses energy, so every watt is worthwhile for humanity. We're looking for curious, intelligent, collaborative people from diverse backgrounds who want to make a real impact on the sustainability of our planet.

The Job

In this role you will design and implement embedded software for a product line of motor controllers in the Turntide Smart Motor System. You will work closely with other embedded software engineers and motor controls engineers in the built infrastructure division to develop motor control products which deliver industry leading performance for building operations, agriculture, and industrial applications.

You will develop all software on the motor controller that isn't a motor control algorithm, and there's a lot of it. You will also work on the systems and tools used in the software development environment to improve the day to day work of all developers, and ensure that the software we deliver meets the highest quality standards. This position requires interdisciplinary collaboration on an electro-mechanical embedded system, and an individual who can work as part of a team to solve highly varied and complex engineering problems.

At this point, we hope you're feeling excited about the job description you're reading. Even if you don't feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in Turntide's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways - not just candidates who check all the boxes. We want people to feel comfortable expressing their true selves and to come, stay, and do their best work here.

The Responsibilities

Develop embedded software for real-time systems
Communicate software design through written requirements, architecture, and detailed design
Basic Software Development: OS, Memory, Comms., Hardware Abstraction, User Level App.
Build scalable infrastructure to support varied hardware targets
Process improvements for automated code generation, testing, CI/CD, and code quality systems
Software Integration and Qualification test definition

The Requirements

Strong interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills in a collaborative team environment
Experience in development of real-time embedded software using the C programming language
Knowledge of typical optimization techniques and how to apply these to real-time systems
Experience in the whole software development lifecycle, ideally, the V-model lifecycle
Experience working alongside controls and hardware engineering teams
Experience programming microcontroller peripherals (SPI, UART, ADC, DAC, etc.)
Experience working with lab test equipment, and debugging real-time embedded systems
BASc/BEng/BS Electrical Eng., Computer Eng., Software Eng., Computer Science
5+ years of professional experience
Bonus Points
An advanced degree (MASc/MEng/PhD) in a field related to embedded real-time systems
Experience working on a power electronics project
Experience using Simulink
Experience with DevOps and Automation scripting
Familiarity with Software Architectural design patterns for embedded software reusability, such as AUTOSAR's Layered Software Architecture
Experience with compliance to Safety and Security standards in Industrial, Automotive, or Aerospace environments

The Upside

Competitive salary + equity
100% company paid family health insurance (medical, dental, vision)
Retirement contribution match
Open Paid-Time-Off policy
Work from one of our 5 offices or join the 70% that work remotely
Autonomy and flexibility to build green tech from the ground up
Incredible growth potential - we are revolutionizing the electric motor industry

ENGLISH VERSION BELOW-----------------------❖ Institut Interdisciplinaire d’Innovation Technologique (3IT) : usherbrooke.ca/3it❖ Centre de Collaboration MiQro Innovation (C2MI) : c2mi.ca❖ IBM Canada Ltd : ibm.com*Contexte :  Dans le domaine du calcul de haute performance, l'intégration hétérogène de plusieurs puces électroniques spécialisées sur un même module multi-puce (MCM) permet d’augmenter les performances des dispositifs électroniques tout en diversifiant leurs fonctionnalités. Dans le but de répondre aux besoins toujours croissants des applications demandant de hautes performances (e.g. calcul nuagique, supercalculateurs, communications haute vitesse), la puissance des MCM augmente continuellement, et avec elle la quantité de chaleur à dissiper. Dans ce cadre, les déformations en cisaillement induites par les contraintes thermomécaniques peuvent provoquer des problèmes de délaminage au niveau des interconnexions des puces. Il serait ainsi souhaitable de pouvoir mesurer de manière précise la répartition des déformations thermomécaniques au niveau des billes de soudure des puces à l’intérieur du MCM. Cela permettrait d’en optimiser la conception et d’en augmenter la fiabilité afin de prévenir des défaillances prématurées et irréversibles. Cela autoriserait aussi d’améliorer les outils de simulation d’IBM à l’aide de données expérimentales jusque-là inaccessibles. Nous proposons donc un projet de thèse visant à développer des capteurs micrométriques et innovants de déformation directement intégrés dans le « back-end-of-line » (BEOL) des puces autour des billes de soudure.Sujet de recherche : Ce sujet de thèse portera sur l’exploration et l’étude de nouvelles approches pour la réalisation de micro-capteurs de déformation directement intégrés dans le BEOL de puces microélectroniques. En s’appuyant sur les procédés et expertises du groupe de recherche du Pr. Dominique Drouin dans les domaines de la micro-fabrication et de l’encapsulation avancée, l’étudiant(e) sera en charge de (i) concevoir des capteurs de déformation devant être intégrés sous forme de matrice sur silicium. Des matériaux émergeants tels que les nanotubes de carbone, le graphène ou le disulfure de molybdène (MoS2) seront envisagés, (ii) développer et réaliser le procédé complet de micro-fabrication des capteurs en salle blanche ainsi que leur caractérisation morphologique, (iii) mettre au point un banc de test et des protocoles permettant de mesurer des déformations dans des puces de test induites par des charges mécaniques et/ou thermiques contrôlées, (iv) réaliser des mesures de déformations de puces assemblées sur substrat organique selon les standard de l’industrie, (v) améliorer les modèles de simulations thermomécaniques déjà existants à IBM grâce aux données expérimentales récoltées.Cadre de travail : Ce projet sera réalisé sous la co-direction des Pr. Dominique Drouin (UdeS) et Pr. Hélène Frémont (IMS Bordeaux, France) dans le cadre de la Chaire de Recherche Industrielle IBM/CRSNG sur l’Intégration Hétérogène à Haute Performance. L’étudiant(e) collaborera aussi avec Pr. Yann Beilliard et les équipes d’ingénieurs en charge du projet à IBM Canada (Bromont). Le travail sera effectué à l’Institut Interdisciplinaire d’Innovation Technologique (3IT) de l’Université de Sherbrooke, et au Centre de Collaboration MiQro Innovation (C2MI) à Bromont. Le 3IT est un institut unique au Canada, spécialisé dans la recherche et le développement de technologies innovantes pour l’énergie, l’électronique, la robotique et la santé. Le C2MI est un centre international de collaboration et d’innovation dans le secteur des MEMS et de l’encapsulation. Il est le maillon essentiel entre la recherche appliquée et la commercialisation de produits de la microélectronique. Le/la candidat(e) bénéficiera ainsi d’un environnement de recherche exceptionnel alliant étudiants, professionnels, professeurs et industriels travaillant main dans la main au développement des technologies du futur.Profil recherché : · Spécialisation en nanotechnologie et packaging avancé· Forte capacité d’adaptation, d’autonomie et de travail en équipe· Goût prononcé pour la conception, le travail expérimental en salle blanche, la recherche et le développement· Atouts : connaissances approfondies en technologies de microfabrication et en capteurs de déformationDocuments à fournir :  CV, notes des 2 dernières années, lettres de motivation et de recommandationLES DOSSIERS DE CANDIDATURE INCOMPLETS NE SERONT PAS EVALUÉSENGLISH VERSIONContext:  In the field of high-performance computing, the heterogeneous integration of several specialized electronic chips on a single multichip module (MCM) enables the performance of electronic devices to be increased while diversifying their functionalities. In order to meet the ever-increasing needs of high-performance applications (e.g. cloud computing, supercomputers, high-speed communications), the computing power of MCMs is continually increasing, and with it the amount of heat to be dissipated. In this context, thermomechanical stress induce shear deformations that can cause delamination problems at chip interconnects. It would therefore be desirable to be able to precisely measure the distribution of thermomechanical strains at the level of the chip solder balls inside the MCM. This would help optimize the design and increase reliability to prevent premature and irreversible failures. It would also allow IBM's simulation tools to be improved using experimental data that were previously inaccessible. We therefore propose a thesis project aimed at developing innovative micrometric strain sensors directly integrated in the back-end-of-line (BEOL) of the chips around the solder balls.Research project: This PhD project will focus on the exploration and study of new approaches for the realization of strain micro-sensors directly integrated in the BEOL of microelectronic chips. Based on the processes and expertise of the research group of Prof. Dominique Drouin in the fields of micro-fabrication and advanced packaging, the student will have to (i) design strain sensors to be integrated in the form of a matrix on silicon. Emerging materials such as carbon nanotubes, graphene or molybdenum disulfide (MoS2) will be considered, (ii) develop and implement the complete process of micro-fabrication of the sensors in clean room as well as their morphological characterization, (iii) develop a test bench and protocols to measure deformations in test chips induced by controlled mechanical and/or thermal loads, (iv) perform strain measurements of chips assembled on organic substrates according to industry standards, (v) improve the thermomechanical simulation models already existing at IBM thanks to the experimental data collected.Work environment: This project will be carried out under the co-supervision of Prof. Dominique Drouin (UdeS) and Prof. Hélène Frémont (IMS Bordeaux, France) as part of the IBM/CRSNG Industrial Research Chair on Heterogeneous Integration for High Performance Computing. The student will also collaborate with Prof. Yann Beilliard and the team of engineers at IBM Canada (Bromont). The work will be done at the Interdisciplinary Institute for Technological Innovation (3IT) at Université de Sherbrooke, and at the MiQro Innovation Collaborative Center (C2MI) in Bromont. 3IT is a unique institute in Canada, specializing in the research and development of innovative technologies for energy, electronics, robotics and health. C2MI is an international center for collaboration and innovation in the MEMS and packaging fields. It is the essential link between applied research and the microelectronics industry. The candidate will thus benefit from an exceptional research environment combining students, professionals, professors and industrialists working hand-in-hand to develop the technologies of the future.Researched profile: · Specialization in nanotechnology and advanced packaging· Strong adaptability, autonomy and teamwork· Strong taste for design, experimental cleanroom work, research and development· Strengths: In-depth knowledge of microfabrication technologies and strain sensorsDocuments to provide:  CV, transcripts of the last 2 years, motivation and recommendation lettersINCOMPLETE APPLICATIONS WILL NOT BE EVALUATEDDurée du contrat : 36 moisLa durée du contrat : 36 moisJob Types: Full-time, TemporarySalary: $21,000.00 per yearSchedule:Monday to FridayEducation:Master's Degree (required)Language:English (required)Français (preferred)Work remotely:No

Software Tools Developer

Turntide Technologies is helping turn the tide on climate change with breakthrough technologies that accelerate electrification and sustainable operations for energy-intensive industries. We develop full-stack, integrated, open systems that support commercial and industrial electric vehicles, building operations, and agriculture to optimize how the world uses energy, so every watt is worthwhile for humanity. We're looking for curious, intelligent, collaborative people from diverse backgrounds who want to make a real impact on the sustainability of our planet.

The Job

In this role, you will design and implement the desktop software for the Turntide Smart Motor System used during engineering development, manufacturing and testing. Working closely with embedded software engineers, the Product team, and the Systems Engineering team, you will develop highly functional user facing software which supports our products at all stages of the product life cycle. You will develop software which allows Turntide engineers to deliver a motor control device of the highest quality by providing robust communication methods for advanced runtime analytics and device configuration. Working closely with the Product team, you will leverage this framework into a customer facing tool suitable for manufacturing and technician level access.

At this point, we hope you're feeling excited about the job description you're reading. Even if you don't feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in Turntide's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways - not just candidates who check all the boxes. We want people to feel comfortable expressing their true selves and to come, stay, and do their best work here.

The Responsibilities

Develop GUI based desktop applications for interfacing with hardware devices
Develop user tools for modifying and loading device configuration sets
Manage device firmware updates
Develop a shared software codebase suitable for delivering independent applications to internal engineering teams, manufacturing partners, and field technicians
Display runtime analytics of a real-time embedded system
Communicate software design through written requirements, architecture, and detailed design
Unit Tests and Software Qualification Tests
Creating user facing documentation of delivered applications

The Requirements

Strong interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills in a collaborative team environment
Experience in development of desktop applications using the C# programming language in a Windows environment
Experience interfacing with hardwares devices from a desktop application
Experience interfacing with real-time systems
Experience developing graphical user interfaces
Experience with industrial or commercial communication protocols (Modbus, BACnet, CAN)
BASc/BEng/BS/OCAD/AA/AS/AAS in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or related field
3+ years professional experience

Bonus Points

Experience working on a power electronics project
Experience with memory management of an embedded system
Experience with Mathworks products
Strong User Experience (UX) knowledge

The Upside

Competitive salary + equity
100% company paid family health insurance (medical, dental, vision)
Retirement contribution match
Open Paid-Time-Off policy
Work from one of our 5 offices or join the 70% that work remotely
Autonomy and flexibility to build green tech from the ground up
Incredible growth potential - we are revolutionizing the electric motor industry

The Mixed-Signal Test Lead will be responsible for the architecture of complex Electronic Ground Support Equipment (EGSE) for testing mixed signal (Digital & RF) electronic units used in satellites and other space-based systems. The chosen candidate will lead a design team comprised of Digital, Software and RF engineers. The leadership responsibilities include planning resources, elaborating and maintaining schedules as well as steering test equipment design, assembly and calibration activities. The Test Lead will also plan for the necessary acceptance and environmental tests of the flight equipment as required by specifications.


Responsibilities

With the help of the flight product design team and the EGSE team, establish the EGSE architecture and the preliminary flight equipment test plan with the aim of minimizing test costs
Elaborate/maintain the EGSE development plan & schedule and ensure the EGSE team is comprised of the right skill mix and staffing level to meet the schedule
Follow through the development, validation and calibration of the EGSE prior to testing units going to space, a.k.a. flight units
Ensure the test plan is reviewed and approved by interested parties
Help the EGSE team provide test methods that meet qualification requirements
Deliver the test procedure for the flight unit production tests
Ensure the safety of the test equipment for the personnel and the flight hardware
Lead the integration, debug and resolution of performance problems of the initial EGSE with the flight hardware prototypes
Support testing issues and failures during flight equipment production


Qualifications

Motor Control Calibration and Test Engineer

Turntide Technologies is helping turn the tide on climate change with breakthrough technologies that accelerate electrification and sustainable operations for energy-intensive industries. We develop full-stack, integrated, open systems that support commercial and industrial electric vehicles, building operations, and agriculture to optimize how the world uses energy, so every watt is worthwhile for humanity. We're looking for curious, intelligent, collaborative people from diverse backgrounds who want to make a real impact on the sustainability of our planet.

The Job

In this role, you will work closely with motor control engineers, embedded firmware engineers, hardware, and motor designers to characterize motors and inverters, and test control algorithms which deliver industry leading performance. We're looking for people excited to bring their passion and expertise to executing the Turntide mission. We're looking for creative people with a demonstrated history of solving new problems and the ability to continuously improve existing solutions. You are interested in the creation process and bringing your ideas and skills to help us make great products. You enjoy working with autonomy and being part of a team of engineers that collaborates to solve problems.

At this point, we hope you're feeling excited about the job description you're reading. Even if you don't feel that you meet every single requirement, we still encourage you to apply. We're eager to meet people that believe in Turntide's mission and can contribute to our team in a variety of ways - not just candidates who check all the boxes. We want people to feel comfortable expressing their true selves and to come, stay, and do their best work here.

The Responsibilities

Write test procedures to verify the performance of motor control algorithms against requirements.
Test against requirements on Hardware In the Loop and Dynamometer systems
Use mathematical and statistical analysis methods on test data to evaluate performance
Generate testing reports to clearly demonstrate the motor control feature tested
Assist with testing of newly developed motor control features
Assist with characterization of new motors and inverters
Develop tools or improve/add features to existing tools to facilitate testing

The Requirements

BASc/BEng/BS Electrical Engineering
3+ years of professional experience
Experience working with lab test equipment, and debugging real-time embedded systems
Experience in tuning and testing control algorithms
Knowledge of embedded software for real time systems
Experience working alongside firmware and hardware engineering teams
Strong interpersonal, communication, and leadership skills in a collaborative team environment

Preferred Qualifications

MASc/MEng in a field related to Motor Control or Power Electronics
Experience in Hardware In the Loop testing
Experience in testing and tuning motor control algorithms on a dyno
Experience with traceability between requirements, architecture and design
Knowledge of a variety of motor technologies such as switched-reluctance, permanent magnet, synchronous reluctance, and induction machines

The Upside

Competitive salary + equity
100% company paid family health insurance (medical, dental, vision)
Retirement contribution match
Open Paid-Time-Off policy
Work from one of our 5 offices or join the 70% that work remotely
Autonomy and flexibility to build green tech from the ground up
Incredible growth potential - we are revolutionizing the electric motor industry

At Abbott, we're committed to helping you live your best possible life through the power of health. For more than 130 years, we've brought new products and technologies to the world - in nutrition, diagnostics, medical devices and branded generic pharmaceuticals - that create more possibilities for more people at all stages of life. Today, 109,000 of us are working to help people live not just longer, but better, in the more than 160 countries we serve.
Abbott Point of Care is a worldwide leader in providing with-patient care solutions that are intuitive, reliable, and cost-effective for our customers. By delivering lab-quality results in minutes, our i-STAT® System family of with-patient products and services fosters a collaborative, patient-centred environment while driving operational performance.
We are headquartered in Princeton, New Jersey, with more than 1,500 global employees and a presence in 84 countries. Our 46,500 square metre manufacturing facility, Abbott Pointe, is located in Ottawa, Ontario, Canada.
The chip manufacturing process starts with a 6” silicon wafer upon which, at an external foundry, a SiO2 layer is thermally grown. A TiW adhesion layer, then a platinum layer, is sputtered to form a TiWPt bilayer and is further patterned to form electrodes which are the backbone of our biosensors. At APOC, we make over 300 solutions which we spin coat and pattern or micro-dispense over active regions of the biosensors. Processed wafers are mounted on frames and diced into chips, which are assembled into cartridges. These cartridges belong to one of four families of products used in conjunction with i-STAT analyzers for with-patient testing: Coagulation, Chemistry, Immuno (for detecting cardiac markers) and Blood Gas.
At our Ottawa facility, we manufacture over 60 million cartridges per year, providing health care providers with 19 different diagnostic tests with results in minutes using a small volume of blood at the patients’ bedside. We manufacture components contained within each cartridge, including a foil pack containing calibrant or analysis fluid, depending on the test.

Job Description:
We are hiring a Structural/Bridge CAD Manager to support Bridge and Rail/Transit projects for our Ontario team. If you design to work on both conventional and design/build Bridge programs, and be a part of a global company that has designed over 4400 bridges around the world - this is the opportunity for you! We have a large number of active bridge projects in the region, and several rail/transit projects with Bridge and other related structures in various stages of design, from concept to construction. At Parsons, we have the technical expertise to deliver any type of bridge design, including Long Span bridges, Segmental bridges, Cable-Stayed bridges, Movable bridges and Suspension Bridges as well as conventional bridges. We are respected for our technical depth, client focus and project execution.
A brief summary of the responsibilities of the position
1. The CAD Manager position requires the provision of expert of CAD support within a multidiscipline engineering and urban planning environment specifically in automated drafting support in preparing drawings, general arrangement plans, steel connections, reinforcement details and other outputs for the specific plans following the transportation and bridge design process. Application of AutoCAD, AutoCAD Civil 3D, and related programs in preparing materials used in studies, plans, subdivision plans and presentations.
2. Organizational Relationship: The CAD manager reports to the bridges service line manager and supports service line engineers in their efforts to deliver the work; interfaces with various disciplines and coordinates the progress of the work.
Responsibilities:
Manages and coordinates the daily activities, assignments, productivity of the CAD team to ensure operational and technical excellence
Ensures the implementation of Parsons Quality System on all drawings
Develop, implement, and enforce CAD standards and provide production and provide CAD technical support
Provide support for plotting and electronic file submissions and provide training and supervision of in-house CAD users
Maintain written technology evaluations for future software adoption and Interact on project standards coordination with clients
Designing and preparing maps to display information furnished by bridge engineers
Preparing and support any design drawings for bridge engineering purposes including general arrangement plans, detailed drawings, cross-sections, and steel connection details and reinforcement details.
Organization and management of plan project maps and plan files
Maintain CAD document archive and retrieval for projects and maintain CAD software inventory
Review projects, when needed for a QA/QC check against the applicable standards
Manage the data coming in and out of bridges service line such as Issue for Construction and As-builts so it aligns with Roads, Utilities, Corridors, Easements, and Coordinates
Coordinate with survey and GIS for PBCD’s, Site Plans, and Utility reviews to access boundaries and corridors
Coordinate with GIS on a database level to ensure all data is up to date and correct
Manage the folder structure to provide an organized source to information
Manage a database of information from Construction to update the Masterplan
Troubleshoot all discrepancies from other departments design packages to ensure a QA/QC is being met per the Masterplan document
Coordinate with other departments for any reviews of As-Builts to ensure updates to the Master Plan
Expected to attend meetings, workshops, etc with all other departments, including A&E’s, as needed to ensure the Masterplan is being followed according to standards and criteria
4. Experience and Qualifications:
CET or Bachelor’s Degree in Engineering, or the equivalent work experience, with a minimum of ten (10) years of experience in providing computer-aided drafting support in the production of maps, plans, subdivision plans and other graphic aids for urban Design purposes
A minimum of years (4) years using AutoCAD and Civil 3D with a background knowledge of survey, GIS, and other and related fields
Direct experience in preparing preliminary design and final design structural and bridge drawings
Basic mathematical and analytical skills and ability to organize and display data in presentation formats, including reduced-sized figures for reports and full-scale drawings for display
Ability to successfully interact and communicate with professional designers, planners and civil engineers

Provides basic technical support on assigned materials for production or customer-identified material problems.

Will also provide feedback to other engineering groups and possibly the customer to ensure smooth production of products.

Lead Cost of poor quality and Cycle Time reduction activities in the Cell;
Lead/Support in FAI process;
Initiate and lead improvement activities in Assembly processes, material, and inventory

Lead product return related investigations, implement preventive measures, propose product design and manufacturing process improvements to eliminate escapes;
Provide design for special, custom-made tools and fixtures.
Good organization skills.
Ability to evaluate, diagnose and troubleshoot problems.
Knowledge of materials and components used in the construction of systems and printed circuit boards and subassemblies.
Knowledge of industry and quality standards for incoming materials.
Ability to evaluate materials, gather and analyze data and determine root cause of problems.
Ability to effectively communicate with a variety of internal and external customers.

About Us
Maintaining our Provincial built infrastructure is no small job. We’re recruiting for people like you to help our Province achieve big things.

The Department of Public Works supports Nova Scotia’s 23,000 kilometers of roads and highways, 4,100 bridges, and 9 provincial ferries. There are a lot of exciting developments on the horizon in our Province, and this is your opportunity to get involved with supporting the efficient flow of communications pertaining to winter road construction, snow and ice control activities, and maintenance operations.


About Our Opportunity
The Department of Public Works is recruiting graduate Civil Engineers for development opportunities. Successful applicants will work in our Engineer Development Program for a period of one to two years. Upon completion of the program, the incumbent can apply, or be appointed to, other Project or Design Engineer opportunities.


Primary Accountabilities
Development Engineers will spend the construction months (six to eight months) in the field working with senior Project Engineers and will obtain experience in all phases of contract work for bridge and highway construction and rehabilitation, cost estimating and contract administration.
Qualifications and Experience
Bachelor of Engineering (Civil, Structural or related) and registered with Engineers Nova Scotia as an Engineer in-training.

A valid driver’s license is required and you must have access to a reliable motor vehicle.

You must be able to manage multiple priorities, supervise people, have excellent organizational skills, be a quick learner and demonstrate sound decision making skills. In addition, you must have effective verbal and written communication skills. The position demands an individual who can communicate effectively in dealing with the public, staff and various officials. A working knowledge of the Occupational Health and Safety Act and computer proficiency are essential components of this position. A working knowledge of the Department’s policies and procedures would be considered an asset. Experience managing budgets and an understanding of the principles of project management as it relates to highway / bridge construction and maintenance would also be considered an asset.
The following competencies are required:

Ability to analyze information and identify relationships;
Ability to be adaptable and see other points of view; using attention to detail to ensure accuracy and quality; and
Ability to achieve desired results; communicate clearly and effectively both verbally and in writing and work collaboratively with others.

We will assess the above qualifications using one or more of the following tools: written examination, standardized tests, oral presentations, interview(s), and reference checks.


Benefits
Based on the employment status and union agreement, the Government of Nova Scotia offers its employees a wide range of benefits such as Health, Dental, Life Insurance, Pension, General Illness (Short and Long Term), Vacation and Employee and Family Assistance Programs. Click here to learn more about our various benefits offerings and eligibility criteria.


Working Conditions
The great outdoors will be your worksite. You will have some time spent in an office environment, but most of your time will be spent outside during all seasons and various weather conditions on heavily-travelled roads or in rough, isolated areas of construction sites.


Additional Information
On October 6, 2021 the Government of Nova Scotia announced full vaccination will be a condition of employment for new staff being hired. View the news release here.

An Engineer must be “Licensed to Practice” as determined by Engineers Nova Scotia before being classified as an Engineer 3.

This opportunity is a term position that will end on December 31, 2023.


What We Offer
Career Development where you have access to career guidance, tools, resources, and ongoing training for every stage of your career.
Engaging workplace. Our Employees feel valued, respected, connected, and tuned in. We have forward-thinking policies and strategies.
Countless Career Paths.

Description
WHO ARE WE?
Dorigo Systems Ltd. is Electronics Manufacturing Service (EMS) focused on offering quality and achieving positive changes in everything we do for our customers. We are a manufacturer of technology products, from surface mount to full box build, for innovative design and manufacturing companies in North America.
WHO ARE YOU?
You are a proactive and experienced Product Engineer who is looking for a next step or new challenge in your professional career.
THE ROLE YOU WILL PLAY
Reporting to the Manufacturing/Engineering Manager, you will be a technical customer facing lead ensuring seamless transition and optimization of requirements into manufacturing in coordination with our Customer Account Managers. You will bring to the team your expertise in electronics engineering, strong technical knowledge, problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills, strong sense of quality standards, and ability to handle multiple projects in order to play a key role in meeting customer requested delivery terms and assuring the highest level of customer satisfaction.
WHAT’S IN IT FOR YOU?
Join our great team in our new +100k square foot state-of-the-art purpose-built facility at Glenlyon Business Park in Burnaby, BC and leave a lasting mark, while proactively contributing towards a seamless and transparent customer experience. This is an excellent opportunity to collaborate with our customers and all internal Dorigo departments (Manufacturing Engineering, Quality Assurance, Customer Experience, Supply Chain, Production, etc.) while working in a fast-paced and innovative environment.
YOUR MAIN RESPONSIBILITIES WILL INCLUDE:
Representing a focal point for Design and Manufacturability and supports DFSC (Supply Chain) in regards to alternate materials to enhance supply chain efficiency.
Acting as a direct customer contact for all engineering activities.
Acting as a focal point for technical matters and collaborates across sales, supply chain, quality assurance, and manufacturing departments to support technical inquires.
Reviewing pre-release checklist.
Managing all customer engineering documentation.
Reviewing new POs in coordination with Customer Account Manager.
Translating engineering requirements into manufacturing process using standard tools and processes.
Releasing product batches in MES.
Managing internal MPIs and Change Notices.
Defining product assembly materials and materials setup.
Specifying requirements for product testing and drives test setup in coordination with customer and test technicians.
Offering expertise in customer products.
Providing and champions continual improvement and cost savings suggestions.
Maintaining professional and technical knowledge by attending educational workshops; reviewing professional publications; establishing personal networks; participating in professional societies and professional development training courses.
YOU NEED THE FOLLOWING TO BE SUCCESSFUL IN THIS ROLE:
